Shows what you know. [Fry turns forward and resumes walking.] Crispy doesn't even rhyme with risky. [Fry falls through the ice, screams, and resurfaces.] Help! I'm drowning!
[calm] Don't worry, son. [Fry resurfaces.] You'll freeze before you drown.
I love ice fishing.
I shouldn't be out in this cold. I 'ave no protective fat, hair, or warm blood. I'm not even legally a mammal.

Pfff! [Fry points at Professor Farnsworth with his right hand.] You dunno what cold is. [Fry turns away from Professor Farnsworth. Amy, Fry, Hermes, Zoidberg, Professor Farnsworth, and Leela resume walking.] I was frozen for a thousand years.
You were?! Uh. [Bender resumes walking.] Learn somethin' dumb every day.
Live bait!

Get your live bait here. [The paper-hatted salesman turns to his right. The box is opened by three tentacles. The three tentacles grab the paper-hatted salesman and pull him inside the box, but leave his hat outside.] Whoa! [The box is closed. The paper-hatted salesman's hat falls on the box. The box is opened again.] [off camera] Fresh-killed bait!
Can we get inside the shack? [Amy removes her hands from her waist, revealing her belly button to be showing.] I'm wearing a belly parka!
If I understand ice fishing, and I'm pretty sure I don't, we'll need to laser-blast a hole in the ice.
No. No crazy technology. [Fry grabs a cutting tool with his left hand.] Here. Bender, use your immense Robot strength to drill a hole the old-fashioned way.
I don't see any irony in that.
And... Woilà [sic]!
Everybody's ice-fishing! [Fry looks around.] How come nobody's ice-fishing?
Hot-cocoa break.
Cocoa is for yodelling babies. [Fry grabs a can labelled LÖBRAU BEER with his left hand.] If you're sober, it isn't ice fishing.
Mom, what's my temperature?
Fifty. Forty-five. [Fry looks around.] Forty. It's all over! [Fry shrieks. Mrs. Fry is watching football on television.] Woo! [Mrs. Fry raises her arms and then puts them back down.] Down at the 35!
I'm really sick.
Huh? [Mrs. Fry turns to Fry.] Oh, sorry. [Mrs. Fry looks at the thermometer.] [bored] Hundred-an'-nine. [happy] We'll check again at half-time.
You home from school, you traitor?
I fell through the ice! [Fry sits up.] Cut me some slack!

Nobody cut me any slack when I broke my spine. [Yancy Fry Sr points at his spine with his right thumb twice.] Didn't even take a day off o' work. [Yancy Fry Sr crosses his arms again.] Lotta people depend on you when you sell trampolines door to door.
Here's your homework, ya lucky knob.
And, with a little more luck from my seven-leaf clover, I might get sick enough to miss the whole semester.
Hey, give me that!
Ooh.
Come on.
No.
Give it to me, ya faker!
No. You're not gettin'— [Yancy Fry Jr jumps at Fry, making him and a guinea pig in a cage on the bedside table fall on the floor. Yancy Fry Jr pushes against Fry's chin.] Ow! My underbite!
[off camera] Come on, Yancy! [on camera] Your brother's sick! [Yancy Fry Sr points at Fry with his right hand.] You'll never have a better chance to take 'im out.
Dad! [Yancy Fry Jr grunts as he pushes Fry's face against the floor. There is a flyer reading NERD SEARCH '88 SCIENCE COMPETITION.] Nerd Search '88? [Fry turns to his left.] What's this?
Some stupid science contest for smart wads. [Yancy Fry Jr crosses his arms.] NASA's gonna pick one kid's experiment to launch into space.
I can make a space experiment. [Fry turns to his left.] I just got a new thing o' glitter!
I'm not sure science is your thing, seein' how that chimp at the zoo tricked you outta your allowance.

[angry] Yeah, well, I'll show you. [Fry points at Yancy Fry Sr with his left hand.] [sad] And Mr. Bananas. [back to normal] Anyway, I've got nothin' better to do while I'm sick in bed. Wait. That's it! I'll make a space experiment about the common cold! [Fry looks around.] Where's that contest flyer?
You're holdin' it, genius.
Oh, good.
[sad] I feel awful. [happy] But it was worth it to catch an' kill this baby fish.
Shmeez! [Fry turns to Amy.] What's with the shmiffling?
It's nothing. [Fry scratches his nose with his right hand and sniffs.] Just a common cold.
Wha?
It's a common uh?
Wha?
What the hell's a common cold?
Is it valuable? Could it be taken from you if you were, say... [Bender lifts up a tube with his right hand and hits his left hand with it.] Unconscious?

A common— [Professor Farnsworth walks up to the conference table and puts his hands on it.] A common cold?! No! [Professor Farnsworth looks up.] [extendedly] No! [Professor Farnsworth looks forward.] [back to normal] Ever since Fry first came to us, I've lived in mortal terror that this would happen!
I never heard you mention that.
[calm] Oh, I try to act cool, but inside I'm [stressed] freaking out!
It's just a cold! [Fry sneezes aggressively.] What's the big deal?

This is the police. [The camera begins zooming in on URL and Smitty.] An unknown pathogen 'as been detected on these premises. [The camera stops zooming in on URL and Smitty.] Come out with your hands— [Smitty looks confused.] I mean... Stay in with your hands up!
You are hereby quarantined until such time as it is deemed safe to enter and shoot your asses.
Eh, now, now. [Professor Farnsworth turns to the others.] Let's not all panic at once. We'll have to take shifts. [Professor Farnsworth turns to Hermes.] Hermes, you'll take the first six hours.
Very well.
[off camera] Louder! [The camera zooms in on Hermes' face. Hermes screams louder.] [screaming] Louder! [The camera zooms in on Hermes' face. Hermes screams louder.] [back to normal] Crybaby.
Look  I just 'ave a common [screaming] cold! [Fry turns to the male CDC scientist and then to the conference table.] It'll be gone as fast as I can sneeze, hurl, and squirt it out.

No, it won't! [Amy, Bender, Zoidberg, Leela, Professor Farnsworth, and Hermes hide on the side of the table that is opposite to Fry.] The common cold died out five-hundred years ago. And, subsequently, Humanity lost all resistance to its ravages. But the virus survived in you... [Professor Farnsworth points at Fry with his left hand.] [off camera] Frozen for a thousand years.
Huh. [Fry turns to his right.] So it was hiding deep down inside o' me? Like my skeleton bones?
Give it to us straight, Professor. How incredibly deadly is it?
[worried] We don't know. [Professor Farnsworth shrugs.] It could kill millions or nobody. I suppose it might even bring a few people back to life! [happy] Anything is possible in science.

Oh, no! [Amy turns to her left.] I've got it too! [Bender, Zoidberg, Leela, Professor Farnsworth, and Hermes hide on the side of the table that is opposite to Fry and Amy.] My nose is all gunked up with blork!
And I've got a hankerin' for a useless remedy created by a schoolteacher.
Uh-oh. I think I'm getting swollen glands.
[extendedly] Ew!
[extendedly] Oh!
[extendedly, off camera] Oh!
Screw the quarantine! I'm outta here!
Initiate containment procedure.
Ah! [The male CDC scientist hits Leela again.] Ow! [The male CDC scientist hits Leela again.] Oh!
G'wan now.
Now I'm sick! [Leela stops walking backwards. Professor Farnsworth turns to Fry.] I shudder to think what this cold will do to me. Yesterday, I was nearly killed by a tight hat!
I'd be remiss if I didn't rub your goopy noses in the fact that I'm immune.
Which is why we'll all be counting on you and you alone to nurse us through this catastrophe.
Why, God? [Bender raises both his hands.] Why 'ave I been singled out?
Everyone just calm down and make yourself a tissue walrus.
[off camera] Damn it, son. [Mrs. Fry and Yancy Fry Sr are sitting at the table as well.] [on camera] Lose the tissues. You're ruinin' Thanksgivin' dinner.
I'm busy with my space experiment. I can't devote precious brainpower to blowing my nose.
You're never gonna win that science fair, Philip. Face it  [Yancy Fry Sr points at Fry with his left hand.] Someone with your limited brainpower'd be lucky to get a job as a pizza delivery boy.
Hey, Barack! [Mr. Panucci puts the pizza box on the counter.] Pizza goin' out. [Mr. Panucci raises his hands.] Come on!
Man, I've got to go back to law school.
Pfff! [Fry turns to Yancy Fry Jr. Barack Obama leaves.] I'm not gonna wind up a loser like that guy.

Sure you will. [Fry turns to Yancy Fry Jr.] You're gonna lose the science fair. [Yancy Fry Jr points forward with his right hand. Fry turns to his right.] And that's who's gonna beat ya. [A boy wearing glasses, a shirt, and trousers and holding a soda cup with his right hand is in front of the counter. Mr. Panucci walks in front of him.] [off camera] Josh Gedgie, boy scientist.
Pi over four radians of pizza, please.
What is that? About a slice?
More like exactly a slice.
Game on, Gedgie.
[off camera] Ew!
I've 'ad worse. When I was shot down over Korea, I had to eat Kimchi. [slowly] He was our interpreter.
[screaming] Coming!
What now?
Humidifier.

Fine. [Bender's chest cabinet starts shaking and begins exuding steam. A red light appears. Leela grabs the bell with her right hand and rings it. Bender turns to his left and stops exuding steam. The red light disappears.] Yes?!
Where's that chicken soup we asked for?

Chicken. [Bender throws the chicken, puts his left hand in his chest cabinet, and pulls out a bottle.] Water. [Bender throws the bottle, puts his left hand in his chest cabinet, and pulls out a lighter.] Fire. [Bender throws the lighter. The chicken and the bottle are in front of Leela. The lighter falls on Leela's forehead.] [off camera] You take it from there.
This is torture. The fever. The chills. And the sweating! [Hermes turns to Amy's feet, points at them with both his hands, and pushes them against Zoidberg's face.] Amy's horrible sweating!
[slowly] That's it. I'm leavin' while I still 'ave my dignity. [Bender removes the green substance from his face.] [back to normal] See you in the obituaries!
How's the... Uh... Containment holdin' up?
Without turning my head, I'd say one-hundred percent.

Howdy, folks. And may I say, "Nice work keepin' those sickos penned up." Put 'er there. [Bender shakes one of the officers' hand with his right hand.] You too, buddy. [Bender shakes another of the officers' hand with his right hand.] An' you. [Bender shakes another of the officers' hand with his right hand.] An' you. [Bender shakes another of the officers' hand with his right hand.] An' you. [Bender shakes another of the officers' hand with his right hand.] An' especially you.
That Robot was a heckuva nice feller.
You'd better stay here during biology. [Fry puts the cage in an open locker.] Mrs. Jenkins dissects anything smaller than a fifth grader.
Well, if it isn't Grandmaster Phlegm. I heard you're enterin' the NASA science competition.
Maybe I am... LL Fool J!
So what's your project? The effects of losing on idiots?
[angry] No! [happy] I'm gonna infect my guinea pig with the common cold and launch it into space to see if it gets cured by cosmic rays!
Lame! Though the common-cold virus does seem like a judge pleaser. [Josh Gedgie strokes his chin and looks around.] I think I'll steal that an' do an experiment that's slightly less... Very stupid!
But that's my idea! You are an evil, evil nerd!
Gedgie out!
We'll show him who's stupid.
Linda?

Morbo. The so-called common cold, introduced by living fossil Philip J. Fry, is spreading out of control. [Morbo grabs a tissue with his left hand, blows his nose in it, and cleans his nose with it.] All citizens are advised to wash their hands thoroughly after beating up Philip J. Fry.
Phew! [Fry turns to the others.] Lucky I'm safely locked up here with you guys.
There 'e is!
Get him!
Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! What are you—
[on television] The situation is expected to deteriorate as newscasters whip the city into a panic.
Run! Run for your lives!
And, finally, the heart-warming story of a handicapped magician who didn't know when to give up.
I don't like the looks of this, Mr. President. [Zapp turns to Richard Nixon's head.] Shall I switch it off?
Negative. [Richard Nixon's head presses a button on his desk with his Robotic right hand. We hear a beep.] Rose Mary, release the Surgeon General!
[off camera] Get in there!
Ow! [Wernstrom closes his eyes and puts both his hands in front of his face.] It's bright out here.
Wernstrom... [Wernstrom opens his eyes and puts both his hands down.] The quarantine 'as failed. Give me a worst-case scenario. And make it grim.

I've prepared some projections. [The red dot on Manhattan has disappeared. Wernstrom lifts up a remote control with two buttons on it with his right hand and presses one of the buttons. Zapp, Wernstrom, and Richard Nixon's head are looking at the screen. Wernstrom presses the button again. Another red dot appears on Manhattan.] Should the virus escape Manhattan, this is how far it will spread in twelve hours. [Wernstrom turns to his right and presses the button again. More red appears on the map. Wernstrom turns to his left and presses the button again. More red appears on the map.] This is twenty-four hours. [Wernstrom presses the button again. More red appears on the map.] This is a Verizon coverage map. [Wernstrom presses the button again. A rotating red globe appears on the screen.] And, in thirty-six hours, it will have infected the entire planet!
Options?
We 'ave only one option. [Wernstrom turns to Zapp.] Protocol sixty-two.
Not possible. We don't 'ave nearly enough piranhas!
Then protocol sixty-three it is.
Hooray! [Hermes puts his arms down, coughs, and raises his arms again.] They're letting us out!
And hundreds of black hovercopters are coming to welcome us!
They shrink-wrapped the hole city! Well, it could be worse. [Hermes shrugs. We see laser rays.] It is worse!
They're flying Manhattan into the Sun! [Zoidberg turns to Fry and points at the Sun with his left claw.] They must've been outta piranhas.
They're gonna kill the virus by exposing it to the heat of our burning bodies!
I'm just glad I have my wool scarf.
What good is a wool—
Guys! Guys! You're never gonna believe this!
We know! They shmooped up Manhattan and blasted us toward the Sun!

They did? Aw! [Bender opens his chest cabinet with his right hand, pulls out a box with SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S MUSEUM! on it and eleven coins in it with his left hand, and shakes the box.] So that's why this was unguarded.
People of New New York, this is Surgeon General Ogden Vernstrom.
Wern-[violent coughing and sneezing]-strom!
No doctor likes hurling his patients into the Sun, but, since there is no way to make a vaccine for the common cold—
There is a way to make a vaccine!
There is? [Fry raises his arms.] [extendedly] Yay!
Of course, there's a catch.
[extendedly] Woo!
[continued] Woo! [extendedly] Yay! Yay! [Fry turns to Professor Farnsworth.] So what's the catch?
The vaccine requires the original, unmutated, 20th-century cold virus. So I need to grind you into a paste.
Professor, no!
It's okay, Leela. This is all my fault, sort of. If this will save you, then, please, turn me into a virus milkshake.
He consented! [Professor Farnsworth grabs the lever.] You all heard it!
Yes, sir. Many of these entries merit a ride in the mighty bosom of our space shuttle. [Yancy Fry Sr crosses his arms.] And then there's your so-called entry.
Jeez! [Josh Gedgie opens his eyes.] Walk much, Gedgie?!
Absurd. You really think your guinea pig could survive in the vacuum of space?
He already survived in the vacuum of my mom. [Fry shrugs.] I mean, "My mom's vacuum."

My experiment measures the effects of microgravity of the propagation of the common cold virus in an anaerobic environment; i.e., space. [Josh Gedgie puts the suitcase on a table and opens it; revealing a sign, seven test tubes, three petri dishes, and more objects; and puts the sign on the table. The sign reads, JOSH GEDGIE - The effects of microgravity on the propagation of the common cold virus in an anaerobic environment. Josh Gedgie turns to his right and crosses his arms.] Impressed?
Damn right I am. [Yancy Fry Sr walks up to Josh Gedgie.] That's some dry, emotionless science. [Yancy Fry Sr pats Josh Gedgie on Josh Gedgie's left arm three times.] Nice job, son.
Hey, wait a second! [Fry looks at Professor Farnsworth.] I know where you can get some 20th-century cold virus without killing me!
Hush, lad. [Professor Farnsworth raises his right hand.] I'm totally in the zone.
We just 'ave to find the Nerd Search '88 satellite!
[sad] I don't know why I even build these things.
Gunnery Chief Bender, blast us out of quarantine.
Aye, aye, lady.
Oh, fiddlepoop! Our weapons aren't strong enough to puncture a thin plastic tent that thick?!
No. But theirs are!
Captain, a ship is attempting to break the quarantine.
Blow them to baco bits with a well placed warning shot!
But—
Oops.
We'll find that cold virus. [Fry raises his left fist.] The Nerd Search satellite was launched on the space shuttle and released into orbit.

Hmmm. All ancient satellites were swept up as space junk in 2113. [Leela looks at Fry and removes her right hand from the device as she turns to him.] I actually knew that offhand. [Leela puts her right hand back on the device as she turns to it.] I'm Facebooking right now.
Aha! [Professor Farnsworth turns his chair towards Leela and Fry.] That satellite was scuttled on Enceladus, Saturn's main dump moon!
Let's dump it up!
This is the exact location of the dump. [Leela turns to her left.] But there's nothing here.
Can we please go home an' die now?
I'm with Bender. [Fry turns to Professor Farnsworth.] Whatever was here's been covered by centuries of ice buildup.
No! [Fry walks forward.] It's under here somewhere. We just 'ave to bust our way down. [Fry raises both his fists.] Remember the code of the ice. Thin an' crispy, way too risky.
[screaming, off camera] I found a satellite!
Let's just hope the experiment's still in here. [Fry opens the frozen satellite with his left hand.] Yes! We're saved!

And now, to present the awards, our very special guest. [The man straightens his tie.] He walked on the Moon and now he is judging a high-school science contest. [The man points up with his left hand.] Truly a man who can and will do anything... Dr. Buzz Aldrin!

Wow! [The audience stops applauding as well. Buzz Aldrin points at the man with his right hand.] I could've used an introduction like that when I first met the Moon men! [Buzz Aldrin laughs. The audience does the same.] But, seriously, there are Moon men. [The man approaches the podium and points at the watch on his left arm with his right hand and clears his throat. Buzz Aldrin turns to the man and then to the crowd.] Okay. This year's Nerd Search runner-up is a young man who devised a way to add and subtract in zero gravity. [Buzz Aldrin raises his left hand.] Vijay Patel and his calculator space hat!
[extendedly] Woo! [Vijai Patel walks up to the stage, shakes Buzz Aldrin's hand, grabs a piece of rolled paper, and turns to the crowd.] Woo!
And now the grand-prize winner whose experiment will be launched into space.

[off camera] Look at that cocky smirk. [The camera zooms out, revealing Yancy Fry Sr. Yancy Fry Sr turns to Fry and puts his left hand on Fry's right shoulder. Fry turns to Yancy Fry Sr. Yancy Fry Sr turns forward. Josh Gedgie turns forward. Yancy Fry Sr removes his left hand from Fry's right shoulder.] [on camera] My money's on Gedgie.
Yeah? He may 'ave brains, but I 'ave heart.
Josh Gedgie!
I'll bring the car around.
What a well prepared virus culture. [Professor Farnsworth lifts up the petri dish.] This will make a fine vaccine.
Good thing Gedgie won. My dumb experiment wouldn't've lasted an hour in space, let alone a thousand years. Besides, Buzz Aldrin ran over my guinea pig in the parking lot.
Eh, okay. Uh, come on, gang. Let's go inoculate everyone and cram Manhattan back into its rightful hole!
This may hurt a little.
Ow!
Now, I'll give you the shot.
You saved millions of lives, Fry. You should feel proud. No matter what your dad said to you.
You still 'aven't thanked me for pullin' you outta the lake, soldier.
I could've flip-flopped out.

I know that. [Yancy Fry Sr grabs a can labelled LÖBRAU BEER with his right hand and opens it.] Look, son. [Fry is looking forward.] I know I give you the business sometimes. [Fry looks at Yancy Fry Sr.] But, if I'm hard on you, it's only 'cause I want you to grow up strong and resilient. [Yancy Fry Sr looks at Fry and then up.] Someday, you may face adversities so preposterous, I can't even conceive of them. [Yancy Fry Sr shrugs and looks at Fry.] But I know you'll pull through and make me proud. [Yancy Fry Sr puts his left hand on Fry's left shoulder.] I love you, son.
[off camera] Now, bundle up. [The camera finishes zooming out.] I don't want you gettin' frozen.
Bucket of hot dogs?
Check.
Butt massager engaged?
Check.
Then let the video games begin! Wait. Hang on. I— I lost my controller.
There is no controller. The X-Cube tracks your motions with a built-in camera.
Oh, yeah? Track this motion.
Frykowski. BenderIsGreat34. Follow me!
Sounds like fun on the bun.
Aw! You guys again?!
Ach! These dorkeschoens. Let's humiliate them with slingshots.
Shoot your weapon, Private!
Wait. How do I— Hold on. Oops.
Sorry to kill und run, but I really must be Göring.
Man!
Pwned again.
This is all Bender's fault. Admit it! Your reflexes suck!
Aw... It's true! My circuitry's twelve years outta-date. I can't keep up with today's high-speed, top-o'-the-line kids.
You can't even keep up with me and I'm some sort o' stone-age throwback.
You know... I might be able to speed up your reflexes by overclockin' ya.
Eh... What's that, sonny? You say it'll put some whoopiee in my cushion?
This may take a while. I've got to adjust the memory timing, raise the CPU voltage, and delete twelve terabytes of outdated catchphrases.
Sounds like fun on the bun!
Deleted.
[sad] Oh.
Fry, can we talk about our relationship?
Of course. Our relationship is the best thing in my life, so I'm sure I'll enjoy talking about it with you.
I dunno. I guess I'm just feeling uneasy about us being so on-again, off-again.
Maybe it's none o' my business, but, if it were up to me, we'd be on all the time. An' I mean all the time.
But what would that be like? I mean... If we were together, where would we be ten years from now? Still here?
Definitely. Or... Somewhere else.
Maybe I'm havin' some kinda... Early-life crisis, but... Look  Don't you ever wonder about the future?
Well, sure, but... You're always in it. Also, sometimes, terminators.
Alright. You should run a lot faster now. Unless you die.
[back to normal] Woo! I'm smart! I know how to spell aardvark. February is the shortest month. There's three-thousand-eighteen jelly beans in that jar.
Damn, I'm good.
I mean three-thousand-eighteen rat kidneys.
Now, then, my man. Let's see if your reflexes are—
Faster!
[quickly] Get 'em! Get 'em! Get 'em!
Eh, foreign aggressors. Vhat's up?
Oh, we were just eating spaetzle and listening to Kraftwerk— I— I mean, "Fire!"
That tap-dancing, decadent jazz baby is too fast for us!
Let's see him outrun a V-2!
It's my brains against your von Braun!
Ach! I could have fired a V-8!
Those guys normally stink. That's why we play them exclusively.
Those cheaters must've cheated!
Now, Larry. Let's deal with this like mature adults. [screaming, extendedly] Mommy!
What is it, you colicky bastards?!
We were playing video games and the other kids didn't play fair!
What?! Nobody rips off my kids but me! We can find out who they are through their motion-capture camera. It better not be those little Korean girls again. Aha! Got it!
[on the screen] Woo! We're the greatest! Mostly me!
[off camera] Bender Rodríguez?
[off camera] But he's a stock MomCorp bending unit. [on camera] And 'e's twelve years out-of-date. How could 'e possibly play that well?
[on the screen] Did you see me?! History came alive an' I killed it!
[on the screen] If I overclock you some more, maybe we can beat those Korean girls!
Well, well. That nerd burglar overclocked the Robot's processor!
And that voids his warranty. Even an idiot like me knows that.
An idiot like you knows nothing! What matters is... It violates the licence agreement. And that means I've got 'im right by his little—
Ding dong. I'm sayin' "Ding dong" 'cause you don't 'ave a doorbell.
Hey, pigs.
We're lookin' for a Cubert J. Farnsworth.
You're porkin' at 'im!
You're under arrest for felony violation of the MomCorp licence agreement.
What's all this oinking about?! Who called the fuzz?!
Sir, who's this boy's legal guardian?
You're porkin' at 'im!
Then the charges apply to you too.
Wha?
Farnsworth?! What a lucky break!
After all these years, I've got 'im! And legally too!
Even an idiot like me knows he'll be ruined.
An idiot like you is correct!
You overclocked Bender?! What did I teach you about tinkering with machinery?
How. You taught me how.
I also taught you not to get caught! Oh, I wish I'd never cloned you.
It's not my fault! I didn't even know Bender had a licence agreement!
Neither did I— Ooh.
Bender, as my newest employee, could you bend this drinking straw for me?
Sure. Let me just.
[on the hologram] First, click the licence agreement, deary.
I really shouldn't agree to things I don't understand, but I'm slightly thirsty.
Oh, God! I clicked without reading!
An' I slightly modified a thing that I own!
We're monsters!
Congratulations, Mother. Can you die happy now?
Not yet!
Darn!
I can't rest until this bending unit is restored to factory specs.
Why not?
If people learn they can overclock their old Robots, they won't buy my new Robots! This will not stand! [off camera] Hoverfish, [on camera] bring me the clock of Bender Rodríguez.
Good news, everyone! That's what the Professor would say if we weren't in jail facin' a life sentence.

Guys! Guys! I discovered I have an extra processor in my compartment o' mystery. Bein' overclocked was a start, but, once I activate this processor, I'll be all like, "You're a big dummy, Einstein! Get a haircut!" Aw! Wow! I can't believe how stupid I used to be an' you still are. What are all these page-y things?
Look out! You're overheating!
Yeah, yeah. There. Now, I'm water-cooled. I can stimulate my intellect without further thermodynamical disruptions.
I miss the old, illiterate Bender.
What's happened to you, mon? I thought you liked beer an' knock-knock jokes.
I'm processin' so fast, it's like I can anticipate that the ceilin' fan's gonna fall an' knock Zoidberg unconscious.
Wrong, Mr. Genius.
Not that ceilin' fan. In fact, lookin' ahead, it's obvious Mom won't allow me to stay accelerated like this. Hmmm. Who's up for a turkey dinner an' a game o' badminton?
Say what?!
Yup.
Uh-oh. 'E must be overheating again.
Bending unit, you are ordered to report for factory reset.
Okay. Sure. But, first, this.
I hear turkey. Woop-woop-woop-woop-woop— Oh, boy. Ay... Ay. Ay.
Ten more processors for me. Once I install these, I'll have access to the loftiest realms o' thought!
Anyone have access to a lofty realm of gravy?
I can conceive of gravies that would boggle your tiny mind! But it's not safe here. So I'll need to find a hideout.
Hideout? Bender, are you becoming some kinda supervillain?
Farewell, monobrains.
Your Honour, Mom is a poor, frail industrialist with three special sons who require constant neglect. Yet, isn't it true, ladies and gentlemen of the jury, that this boy, this... Cubert Farnsworth...
[frightened] That's my name. Don't wear it out.
Deliberately robber her blind by improving his own Robot?!
It's true! 'E did it!
No further questions for this jury.
Before I call a recess for mimosas and horse breeding, can the defence produce the bending unit in question?
[whispering] We don't know where the hell 'e is.
Your Honour, that is something we cannot a-doodle-do.
Then I'm holding the defendants in contempt and fining them ten-thousand dollars a day until they produce the Robot.
Oh! At that rate, Planet Express will be bankrupt in... Four fingers!
It's been a good run, people, but this is the end.
[off camera] Wait! [on camera] I've got it! This building's technically in the theatre district. If we could mount one big musical featuring everyone's talents, we might just save Planet Express!
We'll call it Nibbler on the Roof!
Alright!
Hooray!
We're saved!
I've been thinking a lot about moving on with my life. And hearing the words Nibbler on the Roof has given me the kick in the pants I needed. It's time for me to leave and make a fresh start.
[sad] Don't go, Leela, please. You an' me... We were supposed to...
What?
I dunno. [happy] But someday we'll find out. [sad] Won't we?
Goodbye, Fry.
I dunno, Randy. I just feel like my life's falling apart. The Professor's in jail and now Leela's gone forever.
Stay strong, Fry.
You're the best friend I have left. [sad] An' I barely even know you.
Have you thought about asking Bender for help?
[angry] What are you, Randy? A complete moron?! [sad] I'd love to talk to Bender, but I 'ave no idea where 'e is.
Well, if 'e's runnin' on twelve processors, 'e must be some place with a lotta power and liquid coolant.
[angry] Aw! You're no help at all! [sad] I'm gonna go kill myself.
[off camera] Wait a second. Power. Liquid coolant. [on camera] That gives me the option of electrocution or drowning.
[off camera] Barrels here. [on camera] Can't go over the Falls without a barrel.
What are my chances of surviving in one o' those?
Slim to none.
I like those odds!
[inside the barrel] Wait. This isn't a barrel. It's just a stinking cask! I want my money [screaming, extendedly] back! [back to normal] Ow! Ow!
That was not worth three-thousand dollars.
Hello? Anybody?
[off camera] Fry?
Bender?! Are you in here?!
In here is the only place I'm not. I amuse myself.
But— Bender?! What happened to you?
I'll try to put it in terms you can comprehend. I passed the existential singularity.
Try harder!
I hacked myself inside-out and now the entire universe is my processor.
Whoa! I definitely wanna hear about that. But, first, I need your help. The Professor and Cubert are in trouble and Leela left me. I'm in misery!

I've grown far beyond the petty concerns of your world. Every time I burp, a new galaxy is born. [Bender burps and two galaxies appear.] Two if I've been eatin' broccoli. All existence is just a chess game. An' I can see fifty moves ahead. Human emotion no longer concerns me.
But— But Randy said—
[screaming] Randy?! [back to normal] 'Ave you been hangin' out with Randy?!
Please, Bender. If everything is a chess game for you, you must know how to help me.
I'm sorry, Fry. But some games you just can't win. [off camera] Cubert and the Professor are guilty. The jury will vote to convict. [sad] I can't change that.
Well, what about Leela? Is there any hope things could still work out between us?
[on camera] It's getting late. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some new heavy elements to create. [off camera] Better cover your nads. It may get a little non-Newtonian in here.
Not only have the defendants failed to rebut the charges, they've not even presented any mitigating factors to recommend leniency. It strikes me as an extra-risky strategy.
Did you say "extra-crispy recipe"?
You know I didn't.
Your Honour... If we could locate Bender Rodríguez, he would testify that my clients acted without malice.
No, 'e wouldn't. Bender doesn't care about us anymore.
Someone used to care about me?! Hooray!
In that case, the jury will begin its deliberations. Bailiff, [off camera] release the jury collies.
I finally nailed Farnsworth. Destroyin' the boy is just icing on the cake.
No one destroys a boy like you, Mother.
Thank you, you repulsive disappointment.
Any word from Leela?
I heard she took a job selling deep-space real estate. Somewhere beyond the most distant thing ever observed with a telescope.
[sad] She always liked not being observed with a telescope.
Order. Order in the head.
For reasons beyond even my comprehension, I 'ave returned to testify on behalf of the defendants.
Yay!
Yay, Bender!
[happy] I knew 'e cared about us!
You said you knew he didn't care about us!
Leave me alone.
Your Honour, I object to this surprise witness. 'E's too surprising!
Sustained. Testimony has closed.
But— Your Honour—
Silence! One more in-burst like that an' I'll have this courtroom removed from you! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa!
[sad] I'm sorry, guys. I didn't realise I was late. I guess I'm not as smart as everybody thought.
I was born in prison and I'll die in prison.
There is still one hope. You're co-defendants. An' the jury might not wanna convict a twelve-year-old.
Son of a nerd. He may be right! Make sure Farnsworth doesn't get off easy on account o' that snot-gobbling twerp.
'As the jury reached a verdict?
Not just any verdict, Your Honour. A great verdict!
[frightened] They're going to take pity on him! [angry] Do something!
Your Honour, prosecution moves to drop the charges against Cubert Farnsworth.
Very well. The case against Cubert Farnsworth is hereby dismissed.
Told ya I'd get away with it.
That'll do, pig. Please read the verdict against Professor Farnsworth.
You got it, Judge. I think you'll find this verdict as fair as it is cruel.

[off camera] Your Honour, [on camera] I move for a mistrial on grounds of double jeopardy. Cubert Farnsworth cannot be tried twice for the same crime! Cubert is the Professor's clone. Ergo, they are legally the same person. Since you dismissed the charges against Cubert, you cannot convict the Professor of these same charges!
Well, I'll be a nugget's uncle. He's right!
What a brilliant legal shenanigan! Case dismissed.
Yay!
Yay!
Yes!
Bender, you knew all this would happen, didn't you?
Yes. All except this part.
If I can't bring down Farnsworth, I can at least dumb down 'is Robot. Take 'im away and reset 'im to factory-stupid condition!
Bender, wait. While you can still calculate the future, just tell me  What's gonna happen with me an' Leela?
There's no time now. Quick, Zoidberg! Take three steps to your right!
[sad] We've had some tough times, [happy] but at least we won a Tony!
You won a Tony. Feh!
Wow. You gave up your superintelligence to save us. Why did you come back?
Honestly, I couldn't think o' one good reason. But some decisions can't be made by thinking. Even if you're drunk! No galaxies there.
Knock knock.
Oh! Oh! Who's there?!
Leela?!
Yay!
Leela who?!
[off camera] It's good [on camera] to see you. [sad] Is it good to see me?
Of course.
[off camera] Come on in, Leela! [on camera] Take that ugly coat off!
Thanks. Hi, everybody.
So... Tell us. How's the intergalactic real estate going?
Pretty good. I just sold a castle to the King of Space. But, somehow, I keep finding myself thinking about this place. An' things.
[off camera] Things [on camera] like me or... Things like this badminton racket?
You, Fry. Bender, while you still have your giant brain, please... Tell me  If Fry an' I ended up together—
It's too late, Leela. He's good, old Bender again. 'E's totally useless.

Well, not totally! Before they reset me, I figured out the answers to life's great questions. Uh... This is the reason we exist. This is which ceilin' fans are gonna fall. Aha! Found it! Fry and Leela's Ultimate Fate... By Bender.
Uh, it's probably better if we don't know. Uh, mystery of life and whatnot.
Gimme that!

A wise man once said that nothing really dies. It just comes back in a new form. Then he died. So, next time you see a lowly salamander, think twice before you step on it. It might be you. Stand by for "Reincarnation".
'Owdy, folks! Come on in!
[singing] Jumpin' Joe an' golly jeeper,
Watch it!

Oh, it's just that I love Leela something awful. Do you think a space-age dame like her would ever marry a two-bit, low-life delivery boy like me an' also I 'ave bad posture and severe financial problems?
Have you tried gettin' 'er pregnant?
Gosh, yes. I've tried an' tried, but, so far, I only got Amy pregnant.
You know what your problem is? [He pushes his antenna down and a cigar suddenly appears in his mouth.] Too much smoke in your face.
I wanna ask Leela to marry me, but I can't afford a diamond ring big enough to express my love.
That's for sure. [Bender stretches his arm out and takes Fry's wallet from his pants pocket.] Not on the measly salary I steal from you each month.
All crew, report to the laboratorium. Get a wiggle on.
Thanks for the heads-up, Sparky.
Mhm. Fish on Friday. An' Human flesh the rest of the week.
Movietone News, everyone. [He steps away from the telescope.] I've discovered a new comet!
One side, boys. Let a lady take a gander.
Hang on. Let me just adjust it to your eye level.
[off camera] Holy matrimony! [on camera] That's one flashy rock!
Indeed. It's pure diamondium!
Um... Would it be possible to break off a piece an' put it in an engagement ring for reasons that are private?

Oh, fuff! Nothing in the universe can fracture diamondium. Not even God 1 an' God 2 put together. But behold! [He takes out a large can from his lab coat. Close up on the can, which is labeled "HOLOGRAM in SAUCE". Farnsworth opens it with an old fashioned can opener. The can opens and pours out a hologram of the comet.] The tail is composed of abrasive comet powder. [He throws away the can.] And that's just what I need to put a washday shine on my new Doomsday device. [He suddenly picks up a very large doomday device with a skull and crossbones on it. Wide shot of the laboratorium. Nibbler is suddenly seen in baby clothes crawling on the widow's walk.] Now hop in the flivver and score me some o' that sweet, sweet powder.
Comet ahoy! [off camera] Why, it's lit up like a smooth, refreshing Chesterfield.

Get plenty of that powder. I want this bomb to sparkle like the floor at Grand Central Station. [He pulls a chain. A toilet can be heard flushing. He gets out of the radio carrying the Doomsday device, and it is in fact an outhouse.] Over and out.
Watch it, ya stumblebums! You're boopin' my betty!
Um... I'll be back in a jiff. I gotta go check this comet for anarchists.
Wouldja look at that gem! Slap that shiner on a ring an' me an' Leela will be doing the married, horizontal Charleston in no time.
Alright, diamond. You won those rounds. But I've got an ace up my hole.
I love this time of day. There's such a beautiful stillness.
Leela, I don't know if words can describe how I feel about you—
Good?
Huh. I guess they can. Anyhow, when a guy feels good about 'is sweetheart, 'e wants to prove it by giving 'er somethin' really... Good!
I'm still listenin', you big lug.

What I'm tryin' to say is... In all the world, I couldn't find a diamond good enough for you. But then I found one out there... [Wide shot of the sky above New New York. The comet is floating above the sun.] Among the stars. The beautiful, affordable stars.
You mean... When you disappeared up on the comet...
Exactly.
I thought you snuck off to take a dump.
A man can sneak off to do two things.
Oh, Fry!
In exactly ten seconds, the Doomsday device will blow the stone loose. An', if my calculations are correct, it will land here on your finger.
You've made me the happiest finger in the whole wide hand!
Comet kaboomination in three, two—
Uh... Hello?! Cuckoo!

The diamond still didn't break! [Fry sniffles.] [sad] Now, you'll never know 'ow much I love you. [Another explosion is heard, and gets the attention of Fry and Leela, who gasp. Close up on the comet, which breaks in half. One half begins to float towards the sun.] [continued, off camera] It went kersplitters!
Fry, I don't need a diamond. You've given me the most beautiful rainbow I've ever seen! All the colours of the spectrum!
[angry] Not beautiful enough! A swell gal like you deserves better!

[off camera] What's that?! [on camera] Is my eye playing trick on me?! [Fry gasps.] It's so beautiful! Fry, you've created a new colour! Totally different from any other colour or combination of colours.
Shucks. It's still only half as beautiful as you. [The two halves then finally meet, causing the rainbow to shatter into miniature diamonds, which falls onto New New York like snow.] Whoa!
Whoa! I wish this moment could last forever.
Leela, my love, will you marry—
[off camera] Bernilla, my love, [on camera] will you marry me?
Blorg! Blorg! A thousand times blorg!
Ba-da-ba-da-ba-dip-That's all you get, jerks!
Good news, multiplayers! After a lifetime of toil, I'm on the verge of solving all the mysteries of science!
So we can leave early?

Certainly not! [Bender, who has turned red, complains. #+%$! flashes in front of Bender's mouth.] Not until I demonstrate this new microscope lens, [off camera] made from the debris of that diamondium comet.
Eh, Professor.
[fed up, on camera] Yes, Bender?

Boo! [Professor Farnsworth screams and drops the lens on the floor. The floor turns black. The lens turns white and is shattered in seven pieces. A skull appears above it and disappears as it ascends. Bender laughs.] [quickly] Okay. Too bad. Goodbye.
You're not through with this level! I have another lens.
[back to normal] Bite my 8-bit metal ass. [Bender turns to Hermes.] That's "Bite" with a Y.
Whatever you say, mon.

Due to the lens' remarkable quark-lattice structure, [off camera] it should be capable of unthinkable magnification! [The lens rotates. Scruffy, Zoidberg, Fry, and Leela are also sitting at the conference table and are looking forward.] Come. [Professor Farnsworth stands up.] Follow me to the lab.
Hey, I'm gonna try that! So long, meatbags! Son of a—

Eh, let me just insert [off camera] lens in microscope. [on camera] There! Now, for the first time, we may be able to see the infinitesimal fabric of matter itself. [off camera] Laying bare the most fundamental laws of the universe!
[sexfully] Hey, Fry. I know something you could lay bare.
[angry] Leela! Shhh! I'm tryin' to listen to a physics lecture!
[on camera] Now, to examine some matter. Any old matter will do.
[off camera] Mon, that's some cheap-ass matter! [on camera] What the hell is it?
[off camera] Oh, [on camera] it's just a log I found in a hole in the bottom of the sea. Now, to penetrate its deepest mysteries.
[sexfully] Hey, Fry.
[angry] Leela! No means no!
Oh, my! There's a frog on a bump on this log that I found in a hole in the bottom of the sea!
An' that's the ultimate secret of the universe?!
Apparently so. Wait! There's a snail on the tail of the frog on the bump on this log that I found in a hole in the bottom of the sea!
Dear Eliza!
[off camera] The snail itself is composed of cells, molecules, atoms...
Pfff! Those things don't rhyme!

[on camera] Things only rhyme below ten to the minus five angstroms, you dope! [off camera] Now, ions an' pions, muons an' gluons, neutrinos, gravitinos... [on camera] We're closing in on the very smallest particles of matter! For the first time, we're about to observe the fundamental structure of the universe. [off camera] Such detail. [on camera] Such finely wrought intricate beauty!
It's like staring into the face of God!
It's a mirror into Scruffy's soul.

This explains everything! Even the Big Bang that created the universe! All that's left is the mathematics! Put down h-bar, uh, carry the infinity, and— My-reka! There it is! The Grand Unified Theory! Reducing all the laws of nature to a single equation!
Professor, you did it! You solved the problem that baffled Einstein an' drove Stephen Hawking to quit physics and become a cartoon voice actor!
I like physics, but I love cartoons.
This is the greatest moment in scientific history! At last, there are no more questions left to answer!
Yay!
Yay!
Woohoo! Alright! Well done, Professor. Okay. Back to work, everyone.
Wait. There are no more questions left to answer.
Oh.
And those are today's high scores. Linda?
Thanks, Morbo. Coming up next, Galaxians. What you need to know to protect your family.
How do you people do it? How do you go on knowing there's nothing more to know?!
I watch TV. It's the next best thing to bein' alive.
What's the use? I'm just not capable of the happiness of the dumb. If only I'd made some mistake!
You didn't. I checked the invariance of your Lagrangian. Hubba-hubba.
Then there's nothing left to do! Nothing!
Would it cheer you up if I punched Fry in the groin? 'Cause I'll do it. Regardless. Body blow! Body blow!
I devoted every waking minute to answering the fundamental questions of science.
[off camera] I never married.
[off camera] Rarely went outside!
[on camera] And, now that I've found all the answers, I realise that what I was living for were the questions!
That stinks, Professor. Too bad the universe made it turn out that way and not some other way. I wonder why it did that.
Probably magnets.

Shut up, Hawking. Fry, you idiot! [happy] You're a genius! Why are the laws of physics what they are? Instead of some other laws? To find out, we'd have to recreate the conditions before the Big Bang. It would take decades of work by thousands of scientists in a particle accelerator powered by dump trucks of flaming grant money. [back to normal] Of course, there'd be no guarantee of success. [sad] And, in any case, I'd never live to see it.
I'm surprised you lived through that sentence.
Sorry you wasted your life, Professor. I guess you never know everything after all.
Indeed. The pursuit of knowledge is hopeless and eternal. [happy, screaming] Hooray!
[happy, screaming] Yay!
[happy, screaming] Yeah-heah!
[happy, screaming] Woohoo! Alright! Yay!
[back to normal, voiced by David Herman] Action Delivery Force, assemble!
[back to normal] And me, Mighty Merchandise Robot!
[off camera] Meanwhile, on Space Planet 4, the Aliens who communicate by dancing...
[continued, off camera] Were worshipping a giant comet.
All hail great comet! Beloved mascot of popular shrimp crunch snack! Also God. Foreigners killed our God! Many words of disapproval!
[back to normal] Team assembled! [Leela points at Professor Farnsworth.] What is that box, you old witch?

Ha ha ha! I'll never tell you. [Professor Farnsworth has stood up.] It's a deep space-emotion detector. [Strips showing the faces of Leela, Fry, Hermes, Zoidberg, Amy, and Bender appear on the screen as they gasp. In the machine, the heart stops beating.] The detector can tell you're impressed. You should be! [In the machine, the parabolic antenna whirls around and points up, the heart begins beating very fast, and the screen shows a green graph. An alarm goes off as the graph turns red.] Wha? The marvellous device. It's detecting a massive burst of anger. From deep space!
There is Earth! Attack it as previously discussed!
Flying bananas? Ha ha! I will slice them on my morning fish porridge.
This is no time for one of your jokes, Fry.
I will tell you something that's no joke. [Fry stands up and puts on a helmet.] I will lead the defence fight.
Ha ha ha ha! Don't make me laugh. If we fight, we'll surely be destroyed.
Then what is our only hope?!
We must summon Zagtar, defender of space!
You forget!
[off camera] Zagtar was destroyed by the crystal space devil!
[off camera] The crystal space devil was once my brother, Prince Hiroshi.
[on camera] I mourn his loss. But what matters now is protecting Earth from that fruit armada.
I see your mother, the water Mutant, didn't raise any fools, Turanga Leela. Our only hope is to communicate with the Aliens. And show them our peaceful intentions.
Perhaps they speak perfect English... As do we.
We can't take that chance! We'll need my universal auto-translator!
[off camera] This [on camera] is my universal auto-translator!
That will show them our peaceful intentions.
The only question is, "Who should [off camera] be our spokesman?!"
Me! Me! Choose Zoidberg.
Zoidberg, a diplomat? The list of things I've heard now contains everything.
Hear my words. My shell may be tough like a samurai honeymoon mask, but inside I'm as soft and sensitive as a girl made of custard!
[happy] Custard time?! [screaming] Hooray!
Please! I am certain I will succeed with my delicate manner. Oops.
Instead, I will send the peace transmission. Most honoured visitors, we greet you in peace.
Why does it flap its face hole? I am puzzled, for we don't know what mouths are. It's a threat! Destruct them!
Kajigeru desu!
All attempts to communicate with the Aliens have failed. I fear our only option is thrilling space battle.
Power friends, go!
Launch all missiles! Launch all missiles!
We were defeated in battle.
[off camera] Oh, no! They're forming Gigatron!
Defeat is ours. If we can't communicate with these bone-jelly ghosts, we're doomed!
Professor, I 'ave analysed the Aliens' movements with this movement analyser.
That device was a gift from my ancestors. Go on.
It seems their movements are a form of language. Rather than speaking Ja—
English!
[continued] Like us, they speak by dancing.
Of course! Having no mouths our ears, they could only communicate through motions!
Or perhaps by odours!
That is 'ow you communicate!

Character: Amy, Leela, Fry, Bender, and Hermes
Line: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Then our only hope to talk to them is by doing a peace dance. But it will have to be smoother an' more fluid than any movement mankind is capable of.
What if we hire a buttered geisha?
Another one of your ill-timed jokes, Fry?!
You an' I are enemies now!
Hear my words. I believe I, the most humble member of Action Delivery Team, could do such a dance!
Surely, your heart shell is too rigid! I call on anyone but you to do the peace dance!
[sad] Aw.
Of course, I will do the peace dance. But I will need 'elp.
Super Dance Squad, initiate!
We all hope they're communicating a peaceful message!
Hey Aliens, we will kill you! And dishonor your widows by making them gather wood! Fire a the weapon!
Wha, wha?! We thought we were so smart with our science and dancing, but look at us now  At Gigatron's mercy!
The shame is too great. It's time to end this! Huh-yah! Feh!
[off camera] Zoidberg, [on camera] stop! We are too scared right now to enjoy the ceremony of your death!
No hara-kiri today, but heiwa no dansu! The gelatinous dance of peace!
You may be gelatinous, but not even the Mochi Phanton could perform such intricate motions!
Says you, salaryman!
What is the medical crab doing?
Behold! The dance of peace!
The dance is so complex! The eye can barely follow it!
I may be the humblest Team member, but I have given it my all.
I underestimated you, medical crab. But will the Aliens understand?!
We have understand peace.
Farewell, Action Team.
Zoidberg, you are the greatest hero. You saved us all.
For now. But another threat from the stars is sure to arise next week at the same time!
Until then...
Action Delivery Force star-hero rocket engage!
Pizza delivery! Wow, so this is a real TV station, huh?
Well, it's a Fox affiliate.
What are you showing right now?
Single Female Lawyer. It's the season finale. Wanna watch?
Ah, I dunno. That's a chick show. I prefer programmes of the genre "world's blankiest blank".
She is wearing the world's shortiest skirt.
I'm in!
[on TV] Counselor, I remind you that it's unethical to sleep with your client. If you really care about the outcome of the case, you should sleep with me.
[on TV] Your Honour, it's bad enough to proposition a single female lawyer in court, but this is a unisex bathroom.
[on TV] Overruled, counselor!
[on TV] Could you repeat that last part?
Oh, my God! You've knocked Fox of the air!
Pft! Like anyone on Earth cares.
[on TV] Could you repeat that last par--
This is an outrage! I demand to know what happened to the plucky lawyer and her compellingly short garment.
[voice-over; on TV] Due to technical difficulties, we now bring you eight animated shows in a row.
What in the name of Bob Marley's ghost? Get to work, you lazy boat bag!
Ow!
Ow! Hey, quit it, Hermes. It's Labor Day.
Labor Day? That phoney-baloney holiday crammed down our throats by fat-cat union gangsters?
That's the one.
Hot damn, a day off!
Who's up for one last summer beach trip?
Aw, yeah!
Ready, Freddy!
[unenthusiastic] Eh, I think I'll just stay here.
Fry, you're wasting your life sitting in front of that TV. You need to get out and see the real world.
But this is HDTV. It's got better resolution than the real world!
Everyone's too polite to say anything but you're covered with bed sores.
Not covered!
Just get in the car.
Ah, here we are  Monument Beach!
Wait, Mount Rushmore and the Leaning Tower of Pisa? I didn't know they were both in New York!
They are now. In the 2600's, New Yorkers elected a super-villain governor, and he stole most of the world's monuments.
Truly a great man. Look at him up there.
Aha! [He puts the metal detector down and digs in the sand.] Found you!
OK, now you go hide. [Hermes puts the trowel down and hands Bender the metal detector and runs off. Bender throws the metal detector away and chuckles.] Nice knowin' you.
Come on, Zoidberg, I passed it right to you.
I've had it with this game! I'm going for a scuttle!
OK, everyone, come and get it!
Ah, just like my dad used to make ... until McDonald's fired him.

Bite my red-hot glowing ass. [Smoke rises from behind him.] Wait a minute. Red-hot glowing ass? [He turns around and sees his red-hot glowing ass. He turns back to Fry.] [calmly] I'll be right back! [He gets up and runs into the sea, waving his arms around.] Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! [His ass sizzles in the cool water.] Aw, yeah!
No, Nibbler! [Nibbler runs off with the burger and her bikini top. She gasps and covers herself with the burger buns.] [whispering] Psst, Professor, I need another bikini.

Eh ... wha? [He sees her.] Oh, oh, OK, I think there's one can left. [He reaches into a bag next to him and takes out a spray can and hands it to her. She sprays it over her making a brand new pink bikini.] Oh, my.
There. How do I look?
Like a cheap French harlot.
French?
Say, doll-face, how'd you like to make time with a real man?
No. I'm not attracted to bullies. No matter how big and ... [He flexes his muscles.] ... handsome they are.
It's OK, Leela, go ahead. I got a lot of work to do.
Uh, sir, you don't understand. I'm a professional beach bully. I pretend to steal your girl, you punch me, I go down, she swoons, you slip me 50 bucks.
50 bucks? Not even if she was my girlfriend. You take her.
Fry! Although I suppose we could go for a walk along the beach.
Uh, no thanks, ma'am, I'm actually gay.
Uh-oh. [A lobster pot traps him.] Help! Help! [He knocks on the trap. Bender wanders by, whistling.] Bender, you gotta spring me. I'll never survive in here; I'm too pretty!
Alright, alright, I'll bust you out. [He bends the bars and spotlights shine on the pair and alarms beep.] Cheese it!
Voila. The greatest sandcastle ever built. This is the kind of castle King Arthur would have lived in, if he were a fiddler crab.
It's very nice. We should get a picture before the tide comes in.
Ooh, yeah. Anyone have a camera?

Right here, buddy. [His left eyelid covers his left eye and his right eye zooms out. The rest of the staff kneel next to the castle.] Wait, I wanna be in the picture too. [He takes his head off and puts it on the ground. He pushes his antenna down and it flashes like a timer. His body joins the staff.] Pretend you're happy.
Yay!
Oh, my God!
What in Babylon?
[screaming] Nooo!
Faster!
We're all gonna die, aren't we?
Oh, I should think so. Although last time aliens invaded all they did was force the most intelligent of us to pair off and mate continuously. [chuffed] Oh, yes!
[on TV] Once again, today's winning lotto number was 4. In other news, alien saucers continue to rain destruction upon Earth. We now go live to an emergency address by Earth President McNeal.
[on TV] Ladies and gentlemen, our course is clear. The time has come to knuckle under. To get down on all fours and really lick boot. Give our alien masters whatever they want a--

[on TV] People of Earth, I am Lrrr of the planet Omicron Persei 8. [He taps the mic and turns to his aides.] Is this thing on? [He blows into it and turns back to the camera.] Now then  We want the one you call "McNeal". Give us McNeal or we will lay waste to your cities with our anti-monument laser. We demand McNeal!

[on TV] Uh, as I was saying ... [He clears his throat.] ... mankind would sooner perish than kowtow to outrageous alien demands for this McNeal ... whoever he is. Am I right? [The representatives murmur to each other.] And now, the man who will lead us in our proud struggle for freedom, fresh from his bloody triumph over the pacifists of the Gandhi Nebula, 25-star General Zapp Brannigan!
[cheering; on TV] Yeah!
Hey, look, Leela, it's that idiotic windbag you slept with.
The Earth is under attack. Can't we just forget about that?
Evidently not.

[on TV] Call me cocky, but if there's an alien out there I can't kill, I haven't met him and killed him yet. But I can't go it alone. [He looks into the camera.] That's why I'm ordering every available ship to report for duty. Anyone without a ship should secure a weapon and fire wildly into the air.
Well, you heard the windbag  We've been drafted. Everyone into the ship.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, hold on. I refuse to fight. I'm a conscientious objector.
A what?
You know, a coward.
[on TV] Since this is an emergency, all robots will now have their patriotism circuits activated.
It is every robot's duty to give his life for the good of humanity. [His antenna stops flashing.] Oh, crap!

We're all from different cultures here. Some of you are white, some of you are black. [He stops by a man and points at him.] You're brown. [He moves on to Bender.] And you're silver. But I don't care if your skin's red or tan or Chinese. You're all going to have to learn to die together. [He looks back at Bender.] Am I right, soldier?
Well, actually, I-- [Zapp presses the remote again and Bender's antenna flashes and beeps.] Sir, yes, sir! Sir!
Remember, our mission is simple  Destroy all aliens!
Um, uh, not me, sir.

Oh, yes, right. Nobody destroy Kif. [quietly] Unless you have to. [He sees Leela.] [talking] Oh, ho, ho! The luscious Captain Leela. [He starts rubbing his hands.] This is turning into one very sex-ay struggle for the future of the human race!
Thanks, but I'm not technically human.
Right, right. Nobody destroy Leela either.
The key to victory is discipline, and that means a well-made bed. You will practise until you can make your bed in your sleep.
You mean while I'm sleeping in it?
You won't have time for sleeping, soldier. Not with all the bed-making you'll be doing.

The alien mothership is in orbit here. If we can hit that bullseye, the rest of the dominoes will fall like a house of cards. Checkmate. [Kif sighs and turns to a computer.] Now, like all great plans, my strategy is so simple an idiot could have devised it. On my command, all ships will line up and file directly into the alien death cannons, clogging them with wreckage.
W-Wouldn't it make more sense to send the robots in first a--
Sir, I volunteer for a suicide mission. [His antenna stops flashing and he bangs his head with his knuckles.] Aw, cut it out!

You're a brave robot, son. But when I'm in command every mission's a suicide mission. Which reminds me. [He walks over to where Leela is sitting and puts his foot on the seat next to her. She folds her arms and isn't impressed.] Leela, perhaps before we head into battle you'd like to make love to me, in case one of us doesn't come back.
Maybe we should wait till afterwards, in case neither of us comes back.
Here's hoping.
I'm gonna be a science-fiction hero, just like Uhura, or Captain Janeway, or Xena!
[on screen] Fry, this isn't TV, it's real life. Can't you tell the difference?
Sure, I just like TV better.
Bender, damage report.
The auxiliary power's out, and they spilled my cocktail.
Alright, scumwads. This one's for Bender's cocktail!
We did it! We won!
[sadly] Yeah, but it'll never bring back my martini. [He opens his chest cabinet.] [normal] Well, who wants a martini?
[on screen] Good work, everyone. The mothership is destroyed.
What the hell is that thing?
It appears to be the mothership.
Then what did we just blow up?
The Hubble Telescope.
[shouting] Stop exploding, you cowards!
This is hopeless. [She runs to the pilot's seat and sits down.] If we're gonna get blown to bits, we might as well do it in the comfort of our own home.

You'll be the captain, you'll be the delivery boy, and you'll be the alcoholic, foul-mouthed-- [The door behind him opens and the real crew walk in.] Oh, God, you're alive. I mean, thank God you're alive! [He turns back to the others.] Sorry, check back in three days, a week at the most.
[on TV] We want McNeal! Stop stalling!
[on TV] And now a rebuttal from President McNeal.
[on TV] The people of Earth remain united in my refusal to hand over myself. Total annihilation is a small price to pay compared with--
[shouting] Here he is! Come and get him!
You are not McNeal.
[simultaneous] Huh?
[simultaneous] Huh?
You are not the one we want.
[grovelling] Oh, thank you. Thank you, glorious masters! I--
Give us McNeal!
That was McNeal.
No, McNeal, the single female lawyer.
She wears miniskirts and is promiscuous.
[sexfully] Really?
Miniskirts? That sounds familiar.
Surely you know McNeal. She is an unmarried human female struggling to succeed in a human male's world.
Maybe that's just her excuse for being incompetent.
[shouting] Silence! [talking] We will accept no more decoys. [He holds up a headshot of the single female lawyer.] This is the McNeal.
Wait, I know her.
You do not, you big fat liar. You don't know anyone. All you do is watch TV.
That's where I know her from. She's Jenny McNeal. She was a character on a TV show back in the 20th century, Single Female Lawyer.
Well if they're hoping to see a TV show that hasn't existed for a thousand years, pft, they are royally boned.
[on TV] We will raise your planet's temperature by one million degrees a day, for five days, unless we see McNeal at 9pm tomorrow -- 8 central!
[disappointed] I'm beginning to think there'll be no forced mating at all.
They're going to destroy the entire Earth if they don't see some stupid TV show about some bimbo lawyer?
It's crazy! How could they even know about a show from a thousand years ago?
Well, Omicron Persei 8 is about a thousand light years away. So the electro-magnetic waves would just recently have gotten there. You see--
Magic. Got it.
Check this out  Back in 1999 the season finale of Single Female Lawyer was interrupted by technical problems. Apparently some zidiot spilled Coke on the transmitter.
Beer-- I would think.
They must just wanna see that episode. Let's find a tape and give it to 'em.
There aren't any copies left.
No, there wouldn't be. Most videotapes from that era were damaged in 2443 during the Second Coming of Jesus.
Y'know, I saw the first 30 seconds of that episode. If I could make up an ending, maybe we could act it out ourselves.
I could make the costumes.
I have an old five-megawatt broadcasting tower in the attic.
[dramatically] And I, I could be an acting coach!
Let's put on a show.
OK, Leela, you'll be starring as Jenny--
Uh-uh, forget it. A, I'm camera shy; and B, I get tongue tied in front of an audience armed with death rays.
Plus, you don't really have the thighs for a miniskirt.
Gimme the script.
Places, everyone.
OK ... all set!

Lights! [Bender opens his chest cabinet and a bright studio light shines from it.] Camera one! [Bender's right eye extends and whirrs.] Camera two! [Bender's left eye extends and whirrs.] Camera three!
Prepare the water cooler, that we may gather around it later and discuss things.
[singing; on TV] Single Female Lawyer,

Character: [He swaps the sign to one that says "Written and Directed by Fry".]

Line: [singing] And being self-reliant.

Uh ... [reading] ... Jenny McNeal, you are charged with jury-tampering in last week's case ... [At the side of the set Fry watches on a TV screen that Bender is hooked up to. Bender scratches himself.] ... on account of your hot, naked affair with the foreman. How do you plead?
[reading] Your Honour, I move for a mistrial, on the grounds that I'm also having a hot, naked affair with the foreman of this jury.
[sexfully] I'll see you during the recess!
If McNeal wishes to be taken seriously why does she not simply tear the judge's head off?
It is true what they say; "Women are from Omicron Persei 7, men are from Omicron Persei 9".
[reading] Your witness, Prosecutor Ramirez.
Gracias. [He stands up with his script behind him and walks over to the witness box where Leela is sat.] Single Female Lawyer, where were you on the night of August 23rd?
Sleeping with you.
Aha!
Uh, g-- uh, getting back to the, uh, matter, uh-uh, if it please the court... [whispering] Fry, there's nothing else here. You only wrote two pages of dialogue.
Well, it took an hour to write. I thought it would take an hour to read.
What are we supposed to do now?
I don't know, I don't know. Just say anything. As long as it's compelling, mesmerising, a tour de force.
Uh...
[reading] What say you, Single Female Lawyer?
I say ... I'm giving up the law. [She stands up.] And I'm giving up being single. Your Honour, will you marry me?
No, no! Go to commercial!
We'll be back after this word from Crazy Bender's Discount Stereo.
Married? Jenny can't get married.
Why not? It's clever, it's unexpected.
But that's not why people watch TV. Clever things make people feel stupid, and unexpected things make them feel scared.
[on TV]   Attention, McNeal. Your unexpected marriage plan scares us. You stole our hearts as a single female lawyer, and so shall you remain -- or else!
You see? TV audiences don't want anything original. They wanna see the same thing they've seen a thousand times before.
[à la Arnold Jackson] Whatchoo talkin' 'bout, Fry?

Trust me on this. While other people were out living their lives, I wasted mine watching TV, because deep down I knew it might one day help me save the world. Plus, I would have lost my Workman's Comp if I had gone outside. Now just read these cue cards.
And action!
[reading] Miss McNeal, I'm afraid I must decline your offer of marriage. For, you see, I'm dying. Cough, then fall over dead.
[reading; unmoved] My God, he's dead.
[reading] I will now make my closing statement. With my fiancé deceased ... [Farnsworth smiles weakly.] ... I hereby return to my single female lawyer career. No matter what any man says.
We find the defendant vulnerable yet spunky!
[cheering] Hooray!
[cheering] Hooray!
And ... cut!
[singing] Single Female Lawyer,

[on TV] Attention, McNeal. We are reasonably satisfied with the events we have seen. Overall I would rate it a C+, OK, not great. [Nd-Nd sees she is in the shot and runs offscreen.] As a result, we will not destroy your planet. But neither will we provide you with our recipe for immortality.
Way to overact ,Zoidberg!
[on TV] And now we must return to our planet, to catch the end of a thousand-year-old Leno monologue.
You did it, Fry!

Yep. [He turns the TV on, sits down on the couch and puts his feet up on the table.] It was just a matter of knowing the secret of all TV shows  At the end of the episode, everything's always right back to normal.
[on TV] Honey unit, I'm home. [He gasps.] Monique!
[on TV] Calculon!
[on TV] Oh, how I wish I could believe that. You may be my evil half-brother, but there's no law against murdering the other half.
[voice-over; on TV] All My Circuits will be right back after this word from...
[voice-over; on TV] Slurm! It's highly addictive!
[on TV] Look! It's Slurms MacKenzie!
[on TV] He's the original party worm!
[on TV] Whimmy-wham-wham-wazzle! Let's party!
Look at that worm go. Who says there are no more heroes?
[on TV] Hey, dudes, you can win a chance to party with me, Slurms MacKenzie, at the Slurm bottling plant on planet Wormulon!
[voice-over; on TV] Just look for the winning bottle-cap inside specially-marked cans of Slurm.
I won!
[fast voice-over; on TV] No purchase necessary unless you wish to enter the contest. Odds of winning mathematically insignificant.
I like those odds. [Something rattles around in his can and he gasps. He empties it onto his hand. It's a tooth.] Rats. Just another tooth.
I gotta find that golden bottle-cap.
I've never seen anyone so addicted to Slurm.
This is nothing. Back in high school I used to drink a hundred cans of cola a week. Right up until my third heart attack.
Bender, what's wrong?
I'm sick.
You poor baby. Let me check if you have a fever. [She puts the back of her hand against his head and it sizzles. She pulls it away quickly.] Ow!
According to Bender's temperature gauge, which I suggest you use next time, Leela, he's running a fever of ... 900 degrees.
Bender, mon, lie yourself down. [Bender lies on the couch and it bursts into flames. It burns away and leaves nothing but ash. Bender falls to the floor.] You're payin' for that!
I'll have a look, but I remind you, I'm an expert on humans not robots.
I'm not Bender, I'm Fry.
Really? I though you were the robot.
Nope. Human.
Alright, alright, spare me your life story. [He turns to Bender.] Now what seems to be the trouble?
My tummy hurts and I've been having this burning electrical discharge.
Hmm. Don't worry, you'll be fine. [He turns to the rest of the staff.] [muttering] Oh boy. [quietly] I didn't have the heart to tell him  It's fin fungus. He'll be floating upside-down by morning.
You should try homeopathic medicine, Bender. Take some zinc.
I'm 40% zinc.
Then take some Echinacea or a St. John's wort.
Or a big fat placebo. It's all the same crap.
Hey, what's rattling around in there?
It may well be the cause of Bender's illness. But more importantly, it's a flimsy pretext to try out my latest invention. To the laboratory!

I call this the F-ray. It's like an X-ray only it allows you to see through anything, even metal. Now, the neutrino beam it emits is a tad dangerous, so you'll all need protective goggles. [Amy, Hermes, Fry and Leela put on some goggles and gasp when they see Farnsworth putting on a full-body radiation suit. He picks up the F-ray and turns to Bender.] You may feel a slight stinging sensation -- all of you! [The crew look shocked and Farnsworth turns on the F-ray and shines it on Bender's casing. He adjusts it and the beam lights up Bender's inner workings. Farnsworth points the beam at Bender's head showing his CPU number, 6502, then he points it at his arms, feet and back to his body. A watch has jammed Bender's workings.] Aha! There's the cause of your illness.
Hey, that's my watch!

I was wondering where I put that. [He puts his hand down his throat and hands Amy her watch through his door. He turns from the reddish colour back to his normal blue-grey colour.] Hey, now I feel much better! Thanks, Professor. And, Amy, I'm sorry I took your watch.
Well, I've got to go take this suit to the decontaminators. You two lock up the F-ray and for the love of God don't let it fall into the wrong hands.
What should we point it at first?
I 'unno. Try it on me. [Bender turns it on and points it at Fry's crotch. Fry doubles over in pain.] Ow! My sperm!
Wow, neat! Mind if I try that again?
Huh, didn't hurt that time.
Whoa, mama! Hold still, sexy lady.
What's wrong?
That's no lady!
Damn Chico! One more upgrade and I'll be more lady than you can handle! Why you so stupid, stupid?
Hey, bite my shiny metal ass!
You couldn't afford it, honey.

All this prolonged exposure to radiation is making me thirsty. [He sees a stack of Slurm cans in the corner. Next to them is a life-sized cardboard stand-up of Slurms MacKenzie and the babes. A speech bubble comes from Slurms' mouth with "Win A Party With Me" written on it. Fry picks up a can.] Ah, if only there was some way of knowing which can had the winning bottle-cap inside.
Huh, w-what? I didn't hear you. I was too busy using this F-ray to look inside of things.
Wait a second. I'm getting an idea. N-No, false alarm. No. Yeah. No. Yeah. No. Wait. No. Yeah. Yeah. No ... no. Yes!
Ah, this thing stinks.

We checked 90,000 cans of Slurm and all we won was this junk. [He points behind him to a cart full of Slurm merchandise including Slurm coats, a cooler of Slurm cans, eight Slurm blernsball caps, a Slurm motorbike and a Slurm jet-ski.] I never wanna see another can of Slurm again. Man, am I thirsty.
Fry, are you alright?
You did it, Fry! You found the winning bottle-cap! We won!
[wheezy] Hooray!
Ooh, look at that!
Hey!
Welcome to the planet Wormulon. I'm Glurmo, your golly-rific guide to the splend-tacular Slurm factory.
Uh-huh. Can we have our free Slurm now?
You'll have all the Slurm you can drink later on when you're partying with my good friend, Slurms MacKenzie.
Alright! Whimmy-wham-wham-wazzle! Lay some skin on me, dudes!
Wow! The original party worm! [Fry wipes the slime off on his trousers. Bender dances.] Are you ready to get down, get funky with us?
He'd better be, that's what we pay him for. Right, Slurms?
Right!
In fact, Slurms has to party all night, every night, or he's fired!
[tired] Rock on!
But before the party, you're all in for a fun-derful treat  A VIP tour of the Slurm factory!
Enjoy the tour, dudes! [The leave and he droops over.] I'm gonna go lie down.
Welcome, my friends, to the wondrous world of whimsy that we like to call "Slurms Centralised Industrial Fabrication Unit".
Oh, my!
Look! Flowers! And a boat!
Who are those horrible orange creatures over there?
Why, those are the Grunka Lunkas. They work here in the Slurm factory.
Tell them I hate them.

As we sail down the river of Slurm you'll see our mix-ologists at work. [He points to some Grunka Lunkas stirring cauldrons of yellow-orange stuff.] They take 900 of the finest ingredients, add a touch of child-like delight and mix it all with glacial spring water from our glacial spring water generator. [He points to a Grunka Lunka pumping water into a bucket from two containers labelled "H2" and "O".] Then, last of all, we add the secret ingredient that makes Slurm so deliciously addictive.
So, what's the secret ingredient?
It's whatever your imagination wants it to be.
Oh. But what is it really?
[sternly] That's not for you to know. [normal] Now, over here the Grunka Lunkas are inducing Wumpus berries to release their flavour, using sensual massage.
[whispering] Psst, those berries. Those are the secret ingredient, right?
No.
You positive?
Yes.
I'm just asking cause they look kind of secret.
Enough! There will be no further questions.
Why?
Hey, look! The disgusting little men are starting to sing.
[singing] Grunka Lunka dunkity-do,

Character: We've got a friendly warning for you,
The secret of Slurm's on a need-to-know basis.

Line: [singing] Asking questions in school is a great way to learn.
[singing] If you try that stuff here you might get your legs broke.
[singing] We once found a dead guy face down in the Slurm.
[singing] It could easily happen again to you folks.
[singing] So keep you head down,
[shouting] Hey, I don't pay you to sing! You just used up today's bathroom break!
Hard ass.
[from boat] I heard that!
Now, on your right, you'll see the Slurm Master checking the Slurm for colour and bouquet.
So thirsty.
Then he tastes it. He tastes it and tastes it, then tastes it some more.
Uh, could I have some Slurm, please?
No food or drink allowed on the tour. You'll have to wait until you're partying with Slurms MacKenzie.
When will that be?
Soon enough.
That's not soon enough.
Hey, what's behind that door?
Nothing.
Is it the secret ingredient?
[singing] Grunka Lunka dunkity dingredient,

Character: You should not ask about the secret ingredient.

Line: OK, OK, we get the point.
I was just curious because of the armed guards.
[singing] Grunka Lunka dunkity darmed guards--
[shouting] Shut the hell up!
So you're telling me I could fire my whole staff and hire Grunka Lunkas at half the cost?
That's right. They think they have a good union but they don't. [whispering] They're basically slaves.
What are you doing?
I'm dying of thirst. Grab my feet and dunk my head in so I can drink.
No. That's moronic.
Fine. I'll let go and swim around in the Slurm and drink as much as I want. [He laughs and tumbles in. He waves his arms around.] Help! I can't swim!
Bender, why did you jump in?
Everybody was doing it. I just wanted to be popular.
Ow!
Where are we?
And why is the Slurm pouring into this sewer?
This isn't Slurm at all!
Something's rotten on the planet Wormulon. Look at this.
This all must have something to do with the secret ingredient.
My God. What if the secret ingredient ... is people?
No. There's already a soda like that  Soylent Cola.
Oh. How is it?
It varies from person to person.
Ooh!
Do you have any that aren't so tight around the thorax?
Yes, over in-- Say, weren't there more people in your group at the start of the tour?
Hey, yeah. Fry, Leela and Bender are missing.
If you'll excuse me.
[whispering] Quick.
Look! Slurm! Finally! [He points at a conveyor belt with cans of Slurm on it. He walks over, picks up a can and drinks from it.] Oh, yeah! I'm never going 12 minutes without a Slurm again.
It's the end of the line. This must be where they put in the secret ingredient.
Well, whatever it is, it's even better fresh. [He takes another swig.] Mmm, still warm.
Ew!
Blech!
Oh, Lordy!
Fry! [Fry realises what he is doing and spits the Slurm out and breathes a sigh of relief. Then he drinks some more.] Fry!
That's the secret ingredient of Slurm?
That's the only ingredient of Slurm.
Ew!
I'll save us! [He extends his arms and legs over the ravine and Fry and Leela run across him.] Oh, that feels good!
Thanks, Bender!
[pointing] The exit! We made it.
Uh, Your Majesty, I brought the prisoners.
Well, my curious friends, you learned the secret of Slurm. That concludes the portion of the tour where you stay alive.
You wish, you slimy worm! Hi-yah!
Good work, Glurmo. You have pleased your queen.
Thank you, Your Majesty.
Thanks, ma'am.
How can you trick people into drinking something that comes out of your behind? It's disgusting.
Is it? Honey comes from a bee's behind. Milk comes from a cow's behind. And have you ever used toothpaste?
Whose behind does that come from?
You don't wanna know.
Look, we just came to party with Slurms MacKenzie. By the way, when is that scheduled?
[shouting] Never! [Bender groans.] To the torture cave!
You, my metal friend, will have the honour of becoming 174 Slurm cans.
Ah, this trip is turning into a big letdown.
As for you, you will be submerged in Royal Slurm which, in a matter of minutes, will transform you into a Slurm Queen like myself.
But, Your Highness, she's a commoner. Her Slurm will taste foul.
Yes! Which is why we'll market it as New Slurm. Then, when everyone hates it, we'll bring back Slurm Classic, and make billions!
What about me?
You are free to go.
Yes!

If you can resist this concentrated super Slurm! [The Glurmos grab him and sit him in a chair in front of a tub. The Slurm Queen fills the tub with a dark green slime.] It's so delicious, you'll eat until you explode! Oh, which reminds me, put a tarp over that sofa, will you? Bon appétit!
Mmm!
Farewell! Oh, and congratulations again on winning the contest.
Fry, untie us, quick!
Here I come. [He sees the tub of Slurm.] Let me just-- One more taste.
You pig. Stop stuffing your craw and save us.
I can't see what's happening. Are we boned?
Yeah, we're boned.
I can't stop eating this delicious ooze. But I'm not gonna let you die.
Hurry!

What's happening? [Fry uses his foot to flick the lever up and the machine lifts Leela out of the vat. She runs over to the can machine and stops it. Fry wipes his brow and Bender breathes a sigh of relief.] Just in time!
[screaming] Nooo! [He sticks his head between the grate and tries to lick up the Slurm.] [talking] I could fit if I didn't have these damn arms!
We're close to the exit. I can smell those filthy orange guys.
Stop right there!
Slurms MacKenzie?
Shh! I want you to take me with you.
Say what?
I'm partied out. All I want is to stay home and rent videos and watch them with a few friends. Is that so much to ask?
