No, sir, chief! The main event, so to speak, is downstairs near the wallet. Ever seen soccer players line up to block a free kick? They ain't covering their noses, I'll tell you that much. Well, see you!
Interesting. The trousers conceal a tiny secondary horn.
Hey, what've you heard?
[shouting] Guards! Seize him! [They do. Fry screams.] Prepare to harvest the lower horn!
OK, you can have my nose.
Guards!
Yeah?
Remove the human's lower horn and prepare it to be eaten by me.
In other words, slop a lot of ketchup and salt on it.
Then bring it to our royal bedchamber and put it in the sock drawer with all the other things that have failed to arouse my passion for this woman.
Remove pants!
Wait! Listen. I'm usually the first guy to toot my own lower horn--
[shouting] I'll say!
But in this case I-I just don't think it'll do any good.
[shouting] That's what she said!
Let's face it, you two have deep relationship problems that can't be solved by an aphrodisiac.
However huge it might be.
So what do you suggest, painfully-single human?
Well, why don't you think back to what brought you together in the first place?
Oh, I don't know. Lrrr used to be so tender.
I only wrote that poem to test my printer.
We'd go walking in the woods and Lrrr would find injured little tinkle-bunnies and nurse them back to health.
Yes, but I'm the one who injured them!
Oh, shush. You stepped on them by accident and then you cried all night. That's the kind of sensitive man you used to be.
And you used to wear a size-3 cape. [shouting] But not anymore! Now bring me that lower horn while I'm still in the mood.
Wh-What if we helped you get your passion back without the hassle of mutilating me?
Yeah, we know a great place in the mountains. We could take you there for a romantic dinner under the stars.
Hmm. Sounds interesting. But he would never do it.
Like hell I wouldn't. I'm not gonna be blamed for not going.
Then it's a deal. We get one night. I keep my horn as long as you two end up doing the horizontal monster mash.
I don't get it!
Bonjour. May I offer you a box of wine for the edge of the table?
No, thanks. Just water, please. Tap water!
[sarcastic] Oh, big spender!
[shouting] That's it! This date is over. Waiter!
So, what can I get you this evening?
Your lower horn!
I'll just start you off with some bread. Some sexy, arousing bread!
Fine! But none of that whole-grain goat food. And bring plenty of melted butter.
Why don't you just inject some fat straight into your ass and cut out the middle man?
One of these days, Nd-Nd. Bang! Zoom! Straight to the third moon of Omicron Persei 8!
[eating] Mmm! This jerked chicken is good. I think I'll have Fry's lower horn jerked.
[shouting] It's used to it!
So, uh, how are you two snooky-poopums doing?
Poorly.
My wife is right, for once. There's very little magic in the air. Ready the lower horn transport vessel.
Boy, who knew a cooler could also make a handy wang coffin? [He takes a six pack out of his chest cabinet.] Hey, uh, mind if I stick these in here?
Go for it.
Don't worry, Fry. Things look bad but I still have a trump card; the most beautiful love song ever written.

Character: (singing badly) And I will always love you,

Line: The humans are attacking!
Pluck the lower horn and let's get out of here!
Quick, Fry! Run for it!

Come on, freedom cage! Roll me to safety! [It flips over and rolls through a campfire, setting it and Fry alight. It hits a tree and the door falls open. Fry steps out and pats out the fire.] Yes! I never thought I'd escape with my doodle, but I pulled it out!
[shouting] Just like at the movie theatre!
Give me that!
Bigfoot! He's real! I knew it! The Loch Ness Monster's book was right!
Well, hello there, my furry friend.
Look at his adorable little feet. [Bigfoot bangs his chest, growls and throws leaves into the air. Lrrr chuckles.] Yes, you are a cutie-pie.
Holy macaroni! [He takes some photos.] I can't believe I'm seeing Bigfoot! He's in focus! Oh, I've waited my entire life for this moment.
What?
What are you doing with that?
You're going to kill this innocent giganto?
Of course not. I'm just gonna tranquilize him so I can chop off his feet as proof he exists. Then dump him back in the wild. He'll do fine.
You'll have to get through me first.
OK. Nighty night!
Now leave this gentle Sasquatch, or Wood Ape, in peace so I can finally and at long last harvest this pathetic human's lower horn.
Yeah!
Wait. What am I saying? If I poach this beast's lower horn, am I any better than that ranger with his demented foot lust? Yes. But not by enough.
Score!
This human's lower horn is one of God's creatures, a living thing, and all living things, large and small--
[shouting] In this case "small"!
Have dignity and a spark of the divine.
That's the gentle, sensitive, poet warlord I fell in love with.
[shouting] Uh, you'll wanna retreat to a safe, 500-metre radius!
Well, Fry, it looks like you get to hold onto your lower horn.
As usual! [He hoots.] [shouting] Run away!

[voice-over; on TV] You're on a scenic route through a state recreation known as the human mind. You ask a passer-by for directions, only to find he has no face or something. Suddenly, up ahead, a door in the road. You swerve, narrowly avoiding The Scary Door.
[on TV] I have combined the DNA of the world's most evil animals to make the most evil creature of them all.
[on TV] It turns out it's Man.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Huh? [He scratches his ass and looks at some signs on Fry's bedroom door. "No Trespassing", "Keep Out", "Private", "Keep Out Bender" and a picture of Bender with a cross through it.] I choose to not understand these signs.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Aha!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Bender? I was just not playing the holophonor.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Yeah, well you should try not stinking at it.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: I am trying. I've been taking lessons.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Lessons? Oh, that's rich! Isn't it time you gave up all hope of ever improving yourself in any way?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: I know I should but I just can't. Remember when I had those stomach worms that made me smart? I could play the holophonor and it made Leela like me. [He picks up a photo of Leela and him riding on the back of an angry looking Zoidberg.] Hey, Bender, as long as you know, I have a holophonor recital Tuesday. I'd really like to have somebody there. Please?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Fine, I'll go already. Y'know, sometimes I wish your real parents were still alive. Not often, though.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Whoa! Hey!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Uh, hello, Mrs. Mellonger.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Hello, Philip. [She looks at Bender.] And you must be Mr. Bender. Philip's told me so much about you. Is it true that you're a robot?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: I prefer the term "love machine".

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Wow! Your kid is great. How hard did you say you had to hit him?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Fairly hard.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: The Grumpy Snail. [He plays the holophonor. An image of a grumpy snail slowly crawling along a branch forms. He plays a bad note and the snail turns around and glares at him angrily.] Sorry!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [crying] It's too grumpy!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Ow! No! Quit it! Stop!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Mr. Bender, I simply cannot teach your child.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Then good day, madam! [He pushes Fry through the door and closes it behind him. He opens it again and pokes his head back into the room.] We hope to see you soon for tea.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: It's hopeless! I can hear all this great music in my head but my stupid hands can't keep up.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Aww. You know what always cheers me up? Laughing at other people's misfortunes.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Hey, guys. You missed a great delivery to Space Earth. Where you been all afternoon?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: At, uh, uh, a concert.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Ooh! Was it jazz noodling? My ex-boyfriend Sean played the sax. I used to listen for hours while he sat naked on my couch and improvised.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: So musicians really Rodger your Hammerstein, huh?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Yeah, it's weird; Sean was uneducated, unambitious. He was pastey and hunched--

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [quietly] Pretty boy.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: But when he played I could sense this incredible, beautiful creative soul. Then one day I found someone else's couch fibres on his butt. [muttering] I couldn't believe it. I was really...

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: That could be my beautiful soul sitting naked on her couch if I could just learn to play this stupid thing.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Oh, but you can. Though you may have to metaphorically make a "deal with the devil". And by "devil" I mean "Robot Devil". And by "metaphorically" I mean "get your coat".

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: You hit a sour note about 200 years back, Doug! [Doug, the Hellbot with the saxophone, hangs his head in shame.] Let's take it from the top. [Enter Bender and Fry on the slide. They land at the Robot Devil's feet.] Ah, Bender, Fry. You've come back for more eternal damnation.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: No, this isn't a religious visit. Fry just wants holophonor lessons.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Yep. I need to get really good without practising.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Hell is full of ten-year-olds who wanted exactly the same thing. Trouble is, you have what my old music teacher, Mrs. Mellonger, calls "stupid fingers". [He twiddles his own fingers then slaps them.] With hands like that you'll be lucky to master a belt buckle. [Fry looks down and sees his trousers have fallen around his ankles. He quickly pulls them up.] Now wouldn't it be nice if you had a pair of robot hands to replace them?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Sure would. [He shrugs.] Oh, well. Goodbye.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Fry, you smelly idiot, I think he's willing to make some kind of deal with the devil with you.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: He-He-He is? [He turns around.] Great! Wait, what's the catch?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: No catch. I'll merely pick a robot at random from somewhere in the universe, probably one you've never even met, and then I'll remove his hands and switch them for yours. [Bender rubs his hands with glee.] It's just the sort of guy I am. What do you say?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: I don't know. It doesn't seem entirely moral to--

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Fry, if you don't take this offer right now I will lose all respect for you and punch you.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Well, alright. You sure I probably won't know him?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Definitely probably not. [A column of rock rises up out of the ground with a piece of paper on top.] Just sign this contract.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Wow!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: And here we go!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: I got a hundred bucks on Rectal-Exambot!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Robot Devil? I get your hands? Zam!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Oh, what an appallingly ironic outcome.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: It's not ironic, it's just coincidental. Now fork over those lady-fingers, Cookie!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Y'know, I only put my name on there as a show of good faith for the other robots.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Stop being such a baby and chop my hands off.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Oh, very well.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [impressed] How'd you do that?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: They're very good hands.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: At last! At last I have the power to make Leela love me.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Oh, sorry. That'll wear off in a couple of days.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Check it out, everyone. I'm back from hell and I've got the Robot Devil's hands.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Neat! Let's see a trick.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Alrighty!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Somebody called the Robot Devil's here to see somebody called Fry.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Uh-oh.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Where'd I go just now?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Hello, Fry. [He cackles.] Just dropped by to make sure you're as happy with our little deal as I am. [He cracks and grabs Fry by his jacket.] Give me back my hands! These things are always touching me in places.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Yeah, they get around! But I'm afraid we had a deal.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Looks like I wasted a bus trip.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Yes, you did.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [on TV] Yes. Now you can hear holophonor virtuoso Philip Fry play 900 of these classic themes in your own home on this two-record set. [Behind him Fry walks along a sunset-lit beach playing his holophonor. The hologram flies to the front of the screen revealing it to be his album. The cover features him lying naked on a bed holding the holophonor.] That's over 30 minutes of music for only $14.99.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Only $14.99 for a two-record set. Two records! Oh, Zoidberg, at last you're becoming a crafty consumer!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [on phone] Hello?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Hello? I'll take eight!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Mr. Hedonismbot to see you.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Uh, show him in.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [bowing] Very good, sir.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Ah, Fry. Congratulations. Your latest performance was as delectable as dipping my bottom over and over into a bath of the silkiest oils and creams.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Thank you, sir. That's exactly what I was going for.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: You were the sole diversion in what has been a pale and unamusing season. And so I would fain commission you write an opera.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: But I've never written an opera.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: And I've never heard one. Still, if you can keep me amused through the overture I shall consider it a smashing success.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: But I wouldn't even know what to write about. Unless... [He turns and looks at Leela, who sits at the table gorging on a buggalo leg dripping with barbecue sauce. He smiles and turns to Hedonismbot.] OK, I'll do it. If I can make it about Leela.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Me? Really?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: A man writing an opera about a woman? [He laughs.] Oh, sirrah, how deliciously absurd! [He turns around to the door.] I shall see you at the premiere.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Is it part of the opera?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Leela! [He stands up.] You shouldn't be listening. I don't want you to hear it till it's done.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: But it's so beautiful.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: So's a peacock but you don't eat it until it's cooked. This has to be perfect. I want you to hear exactly what I hear when I think about you.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Oh, Fry. All this time you've had this incredible gift and I never knew. I've been a fool. A fully-justified, prudent fool. [She looks into his eyes and holds his hands then quickly takes hers away.] They're so cold.

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [shouting; from street] And yet hell is so hot! [He laughs briefly.] Can I have my hands back now?

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [shouting] No!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: [shouting; from street] You're not nice!

Episode: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Line: Ah, Bender, this is a surprise! For you! Finding me in the refrigerator.

Line: Planet Express delivery company roll call! Captain Turanga Leela!
Here!
Delivery boy, first class, Philip J. Fry!
Here!
Assistant Manager of Sales, Bender Bending Rodriguez!
Here! [Falls on Fry and Leela from above] Cerveza, por favor.
Long-term intern, Amy Wong.
Here!
Company physician, Dr. John A. Zoidberg.
Huh? I thought it was mine!
Bureaucrat Grade 34, Hermes Conrad
Is who I am. And now I am proud to present the owner and founder of Planet Express, Professor Hubert J. Farnsworth!
You're all fired.
Sweet bongo of the Congo!
In fact, you were fired two years ago! That's when we were shut down by the delivery network.
Yes, I'm afraid the brainless drones who run the network canceled our license.
We were canceled?
Oh, it's terrible. Just terrible. Well, clear out your desks and move along. Chop-chop.
Yes? I see.
Good news, everyone! Those asinine morons who cancelled us were themselves fired for incompetence.
Woohoo!
And not just fired, but beaten up, too. And pretty badly.
Woo!
In fact, most of them died from their injuries.
Woo? [Bender laughs]
And then they were ground up into a fine pink powder.
Why?
Oh, it's got a million and one uses.
Ahhh, that soothes the fire.
So what does this mean for us and our many fans?
It means we're back on the air!
Yes, flying on the air in our mighty spaceship!
Woooohoooo!
We're back, baby!
Party! Go, go, go!
Lower, lawn mower!
What's the matter, robot? You got a rod up your spine?
Yes, I do. That's how I'm built.
Hooray.
Way to bend it!
You're the greatest, Bender!
In Jamaica, we got 10-story office buildings lower than that.
Let's see you beat it, Rastaman.
Ooooohh...
Let's make it interesting. Fetch down one of them sabres.
Oh, flexible. That would go good up my spine.
Lower.
The fat guy wins!
Go, Hermes!
That's why they call me 11-inch Conrad.
Oh, no.
Can you save Hermes, Dr. Goodensexy?
I told you, my name is Dr. Cahill.
Figures I'd get mangled while the blonde bimbo's on duty.
I'm a doctor, sir. The mere fact that I'm blonde and have a breathy voice, full sensual lips, and a steaming hot body doesn't make me a bimbo.
Tell me about it.
I think we've all learned a thing or two about sexual stereotypes. While my head's slowly dying 'cause I'm not in a jar yet, you bimbo!
Oh, right. Ditzy-witzy! Lars, got another jar job!
Oh, sorry, Doctor. I was disinfecting Courtney Love... Oh, hello.
What are you looking at? Is it the eye?
Guilty as charged. It's a nice looking eye, and there's plenty of it.
Oh. Do I know you?
Apparently not. Hi. I'm Lars.
Oh. I'm Leela. Nice to meet you.
Nice to be met.
Pick up ladies on your own time, you shiny-headed goat!
Sir, you're just a little enraged 'cause you're dying. Up and away!
Lars is so flirting with you.
He is so not. He's just being polite.
Who does he think he is, being polite to you? You want me to beat him up?
No. Stop being so immature.
I'll show her who's immature.
"Charles de Gaulle"? Never heard of you.
I freed France from the Nazis and...
Hey, Leela. I'm some French guy.
Rock that Frenchman, baby!
Oh, my poor little love pirate of the Caribbean!
There, there, wife. Everything will be all--
Okay, look, Hermes, we got to think of the boy. He needs a daddy.
He has a daddy!
No, he got two half-daddies. Will his body be all right?
Yes, but it may take a few days.
No, not soon enough. Come, Dwight, let's find you a handsome new father.
LaBarbara, no!
It's okay, Hermes. We're all here for you.
Good news, everyone! We've got a delivery to the nude beach planet.
Woohoo!
So long, jerk.

[voice-over] Futurama is brought to you by ... [The oval zooms back into a corner and is replaced by a can of Torgo's Executive Powder.] ... Torgo's Executive Powder. [cut to cutouts of human heads and shoulders going into a grinder, producing pink powder] Only Torgo's packs the power of five highly paid television executives into every can for maxim odour absorption.
[singing] When your toilet smells like faeces,
It feels great to be back at the wheel after two long years.
That's not the wheel.
It's nice out.
"You must be at least this naked"? How much nakeder could you be?
Watch and learn.
You know, it's funny.
What?
Your weiner!
Well, I'm going in the water to prune up a bit before I strut. Who's with me?
I'm in!
I'm in.
Yeah, I'll go.
You guys go ahead. I gotta find the bartender and deliver this box of barstool softener.
Here's your package, sir.
Why are you talking to my penis?
Oh, sorry. Sign here.
Mind if I use your pen?
Well, that's not a...
And initial here. [screams again OC]
Thank you for using Planet Express.
Hey, Fry, I didn't know you had a tattoo of Bender on your ass.
Me neither.
You got a tattoo of me? Neat. It's like looking in a smelly mirror.
So he's got a little ink. Big whoop.
Sweet photons. I don't know if you're waves or particles, but you go down smooth.
Sir, would you care to sign our petition?
I support and oppose many things, but not strongly enough to pick up a pen.
That's just what the guys who oppose the things you support want you to do.
Really? Down with those guys!
And we'll need your e-mail address.
Hmm, they say you shouldn't give out your e-mail address.
Right. That's just what those same guys say.
Them again?
I don't quite understand what this petition's about.
Animals?
And your e-mail address.
You won't send me any spam, will you?
Oh, no, no, no, no. Asterisk.
You've got spam.
Spam, spam, junk.
Spam. Spam. "Hi. How are you?" Oh, that must be from Kiffy.
Hi, how are you? Low, low prices on erectile dysfunction remedies, sleeping pills, old-person drugs, and antidepressants.
Antidepressants? Well, I certainly don't want to get depressed.
Please enter credit card number.
Is cash okay?
Porn. Porn. Free porn. Get rich watching porn? I find that rather hard to believe.
Warning, perform virus scan? I'm waiting for porn over here.
Oh, yeah, come on, baby.
Friends, friends! His Majesty Prince Adisaraki O. Zoidberg of Nigeria died.
When will those antidepressants get here?
Wait, there's more. Once I wire some good-faith money to an overseas bank account, I'll inherit his kingdom, his canoe, and his plump young wife.
You dumb stumps. Don't you realize you're being scammed?
That is low, Hermes. Just because you don't have a body, you don't want anyone else to be prince of Nigeria. Well, try and stop me from wiring that money.
What's going on here? According to my illegal key logging software, you've all been giving out personal information over the Internet. If Hermes were here, he'd fire you all.
I am here!
Quiet, you. In his absence, I'm calling a mandatory company security seminar. To the mandatorium!
Now, it's not hard to spot a phoney Internet come-on. "Get rich quick x7 q"? Phoney. "Lose weight with space parasites"? Phoney. What's this? I've won the Spanish National Lottery?
No, it's a scam!
My goodness, I'm rich! And to think I didn't even know I had a ticket. I just need to wire some collateral to collect the winnings.
Professor, stop! You're giving away personal information!
I can afford to give away anything I want. I've won the Spanish National Lottery.
No, don't!
It's a scam!
Why won't anybody listen to me?!?
And my mother's maiden name and her bank account numbers and ... There! I'm rich. Rich. Rich!
That must be my $400 now. Hello. Or should I say, '"Buenos dias"?
Hi. We own your company now.
Hwhaa?
Welcome, boss.
Guess I was wrong. There was a robot stupid enough to download the obedience virus.
I sure was. Make a hole, chumps. [Bender gets a red carpet out of his cavity and imitates a trumpet fanfare] Presenting our new masters!

Character: Bender [carrying a stack of crates bigger than he is]
Line: Where shall I put these auto-dialers, kind master?
Between the password crank and the spamjaculator. Come on! We've got a whole planet to scam. And bring me some more Gummi Fungus!
We don't have to stand here and take abuse from a gross nerd.
Yeah!
Yeah!
Hi-yah!
Now get back to work, you turkeys. Planet Express is still in business. We've got crap loads of quote-unquote merchandise to deliver.
Ship them out, Your Highness.
Finally, some respect.
I feel a little better.
Those marvellous scammers sure scammed us, huh?
How can you just sit there kissing the aliens' butt flaps? Don't you realize you are totally under their control?
Of course I realize it. Does that mean I can't enjoy it? Boy, were we suckers.
Greetings, earthlings.
Oh, hooray. It's handsome Lars and his fabulous jars.
Hello, everyone who isn't Leela. And a special hello to everyone else.
Shut your lockers and get to class. How's my body doing?
Oh, I'm afraid it's behind schedule. The museum got tricked into giving all its funding to something called the Scamming Sciences Institute.
It's a fake place.
No! That body's the cornerstone of my marriage. What's LaBarbara going to do?
Spluh! She's going to go back to her first husband.
Barbados Slim? I love that guy.
Everybody loves Slim.
He's the only man to ever win Olympic gold medals in both limbo and sex.
Well, maybe I should get going.
Yes, I'll show you out.
No, Leela will show him out.
No, Leela will show you out. Me. Leela.
So your friend, Fry, seems nice. Are you and he dati--?
Nope.
Good, because I was maybe thinking of asking you out for dinner.
Ohhhh. I'll start maybe thinking about saying "Sure, when?"
Let me maybe give it some thought.
Tomorrow at 8 00?
Okay.
It's not fair. I've loved Leela since the day I came to the future. Did I show you the macaroni valentine I made for her?
Yes.
Look at it again. I know she thinks I'm immature, but someday I won't be. And deep down in my heart, I know we'll end up together. It's all there in the macaroni.
Lars asked me out!
What are you doing, wonderful masters?
Sprunjing for information.
Oh! There's something here. I can sprunje it. Robot, tear it open!
Goody, goody, goody, goody!
What's that thing on your neck?
Checking out my sprunjer, huh?
I guess. What does it do?
It's a special sense organ our species possesses. It engorges in the presence of... [moans] Information.
Lucky you. All I have is a gland that gives off foul odors when I'm bored.
Hey, look, a safe!
That's my safe. I call keep-offsies.
No callsies! Open it!
It's a gold mine. Tax forms, Social Security cards. Combination hair, blood and stool samples!
I don't get it. How can you say Lars is more mature than me?
Well, for one thing, his chequebook doesn't have the Hulk on it.
Who are you?
Philip J. Fry.
Social Security Number 03280810? Stool type, P-negative?
That's right.
I've never detected so much information before. I think it may be a Level 87 code.
Level 87? Can it be? I thought it was only a legend, but the sprunjer never lies.
It's in his pants!
What the hell are you talking about?

Character: Nudar [holding a laser to Farnsworth's head]
Line: Faster, faster!
I'm sciencing as fast as I can.
What do you say, folks? Hot or not?
You, boogerbot, read the code or I'll shoot this guy.
Who the hell is he?
I'm Scruffy, the janitor.

Hang on, Scruffy! Zero, zero, one, one, zero, zero, zero, one, zero, zero, one, zero, zero, one, one, one, one, zero, one, zero, zero, zero, zero, one, one, zero, one, one, zero, one, one, one, zero, zero, one, one.
Huh?
A time sphere.
Naked brothers, we have sprunjed upon the universal machine language time code. The key to time travel!
What's the secret of time travel doing on Fry's ass?
It was bound to be somewhere.
Beyond this shimmering portal lie all the glories of history.
And we can steal them! We just go to the past and take stuff with our superior weapons!
Stop, you fools!
What's going on?
What is happening?
Nibbler, you... You can talk?
I can do more than talk. I can pontificate. You must not use the code of codes. With each and every use, you risk tearing the universe asunder.
The poodle-monkey may be right. The legend warns that the code is powerful and dangerous.
My God. We'd better use it only three or four times. Six, max.
But even a single use could shatter the universe!
Got it. Two or three times.
I see I have no choice. Nibblonians, attack!
Hey! That tickles.
And the pitch!
Mayday, mayday!
Hey! Hey! Hey!
Scamper!
Aawww...
Alas, our kitten-class attack ships were no match for their mighty chairs. The universe is doomed. Doomed!
Can I pull up my pants now?
Dooooooomed!
Stand back you wing wangs. I'm gonna try out this timesphere with a quick test drive to yesterday.
Bushwah. You can't go mucking about in the past without creating paradoxes.
I'm afraid he can. It's a paradox correcting time code. It all works perfectly. Except when it rips open the universe. Don't do it, I beg you ...
Yesterday please, and make it snappy.
wha???
Hello.
Howdy.
Hey! What the ...?
There was one, but now there's two.
Nothing gets past you eagle eye. I went back to last night and met the me of that time for a drink. One thing led to another and we ended up at my place, or should I say our place.
Blech.
Oh come on ya bunch of prudes.
This isn't merely revolting, it's impossible to boot. I know a paradox when I see one.
Whaaa?
Ahh, paradox resolved. Someone get a mop.
You're looking well pops.
How can you look me in the eye 'n eye and say that? I'm nothin' but a brain. A useless, filthy brain.
You forgot lice infested.
I didn't forget it, I just chose not to .... [gasps] Barbados Slim! What are you doin' here? IS there somethin' goin' on between you two?
Oh no no no no, we jus' ah happened to run into each other shortly after your accident.
And every night since then.
You're so crazy.
Woman! No! Ohh, who am I kiddin'? Without my body, I'm a nobody.
I'm sorry Hermes. But look at Barbados. You can't argue with those luscious pecks.
No I can't. But I can ask him to stop wiggling them in my face.
I'm not wiggling them. They do that by themselves.
I think I'll go back in time and steal the Liberty Bell before it cracked. Or is the crack the valuable part?
I don't know you naked crook.
[reading from "A Brief History of Time Travel"] We have a problem Nudar. It's a one way time code. It can take us to the past, but it can't bring us back to the present.

Oh oh oh oh oh oh! Masters, if I might, let me do the stealing. I'll go to the past and snatch everything I can get my greasy mitts on. Then, as a robot, I could just wait it out for a few centuries in the limestone cavern beneath this building. Oh, it'll be ever so much fun.
Hey, that's perfect. We sit back and let dum dum here do the stealing.
Dum dum away. Zero zero one one ....
The Mona Lisa!
Sorry, it's not quite finished.
Da Vinci give you any trouble?
Let's just say he may not make it to The Last Supper. Hahahahahaha.
Preposterous twaddlecock. Time travel is impossible.
But Professor, you time traveled yourself, remember, when we went back to Roswell?
That proves nothing. And furthermore, you'd think I'd remember a thing like that. Plus, who are you anyway?
Man, this is fun on a bun. Here I go again.
Oh no you don't.
Scarab, four arm, bird, bird, bird!
Boo! Hahahaha. Naw, it's just me, Bender.
I must tell you Hedonismbot, I hate to sell my doomsday devices to a private collector. But with my business stolen I have to make ends meet. You will be careful?
I shan't touch them till I've had Jambi lock the absinthe and ether away. Ohhhh, what does this one do?
Uh, that one kills everything everywhere.
How delightful. And this one?
Sir! The sphereoboom is not for sale.
It's my sentimental favorite.
No need to explain. I too have known unconventional love. Perhaps you and I, and Jambi, could get together and compare notes sometime, eh?
... resulting in peace between east and west coat rappers ...
Good god!
I accept this Nobel peace prize not just for myself, but for crime robots everywhere. Skål!
Not so neutral now, are you Sweden?
Be honest with me. Does my eye look monstery? I don't want to look monstery for my date with Lars.
At least a monster has a body. What I wouldn't give for Wolfman's torso, or any of the groovy ghoulies.
Ohh, I think I'll wear that slutty dress I've been saving for Easter.
I'd like to punch Lars right in his ruggedly good looking face!
Like all rich people, we're gonna need weapons to shoot poor people.
In self defense?
Yes, that too. Bender, go steal the doomsday device chained to the professor's wrist.
Never! Ha ha, I'm kidding. You guys know I have to do whatever you say.
Here, swap this for the real one.
Ahhh! The old switcheroo.
Yes, but don't wake him. You'll need jeweler's tools and foot cup silencers.
Hey, I don't tell you how to tell me what to do, so don't tell me how to do what you tell me to do. Bender knows when to use finesse.
Here ya go.
Put it in the safe, clanky.
Owww!
Wheeeeeeee.
It's the damdest thing ...
... there I was in the dumpster enjoying a moldy fudgesicle when suddenly your hand flies over and slaps me in the tokhes.
Yes, well, these things happen. Fortunately the sphereoboom is still safe.
Scammed? Me!? Sweetheart?!? Ohh!
You do a nice hand job, Zoidberg. Tell me, If I could find an undamaged body, could you recapitate me?
Hermes, I'm a surgeon. When I see two body parts I sew them together and see what happens.
Hmmm.
All I'm askin' is for you to go back in time to when I still had my body and bring it back for me.
What do I do with your old head?
I don't care in the slightest.
[brandishing bloody hack saw] Can do!
Come on, mon!
[pouring some liquid from Hermes' jar into the bowl] Hermes, please. You can't hurry a delicate operation like this.
Ohh! ... Ug! ... Argh! ... Ahhhhhh. [looking down] What are those?
You incompetent crab!
I thought you were happy, your tail is wagging.
Grrrrrr....
I believe this paradoicality equation to be unsolvable, ergo time travel is impossible. But I can't quite prove it, Bubblegum. Perhaps you and your razzle dazzle Globetrotter calculus could ...
[interrupting] Looks pretty damn solvable to me, Farnsy. Sweet Clyde, use variation of parameter and expand the Wronskian.
Shizz, baby. So paradox free time travel is possible after all.
Right on. But dig this multiplicand here.
The doom field? That must be what corrects the paradoxes.
When that momma rises exponentially, it could rupture the very fabric of causality.
That's what I've been trying to tell you.
Hermes, you got your body back. Hurrah!
Yes, but not the original. Bender went back in time and picked up a copy.
A copy! Funky cold medina. According to this equation, a time travel duplicate results in a complex denominator in the causality ratio.
Oh Snap! Bet you know what that means.
I can guess. Actually, I can't guess.
Prof, you got a doom meter in this lab.
[looking at doom meter showing nearly 1000 millidooms] Good Lord, Bubblegum. The duplicate body is emitting doom at ten times the back ground level.
I thought as much. A duplicate body is always doomed. It's just a matter of time.
I don't care. I just need it long enough to bird dog in an win LaBarbara back.
Best bird dog fast my brother.
That the way I bird dog best.
Drink, quick. I can't balance it much longer.
Wait .. I .. [Leela drinks]
Yes!
This is so much fun Lars. Most men are intimidated by the fact that I could kill them with the flick of my wrist.
Well not me. 'Cause if you do, you'll be stuck with the check.
[with a spice weasel] Folks, care for a little fresh ground executive?
Please.
Bam!
Don't get excited kids, this thing's got heart shaped nostrils. Want to see it make a star?
No!
Here's your Gutenberg Bible master. Plus the Colonel's secret recipe  Chicken, Grease, Salt.
Well, that does it. We've got every valuable object in history.
Owww!
Hmm. Now that I'm rich I suddenly care if the universe gets destroyed. We can't use that dangerous time code again. Blank it from the robot's memory.
Ahhhhh.
[looking at Fry] I'll vaporize this guy so his ass doesn't fall into the wrong hands.
Why don't you just remove my tattoo?
Nice try. But you might have memorized it.
No I mighn't. I can't even remember my mother's maiden name.
It's Gleisner.
[running] Stupid naked aliens. Stupid Lars. I hate the future.
Hmmmm!
Man, that cube root was a real buzzer beater, Clyde.
Zero. One. One. One. Zero. Zero. One. One!
Blast him.
Ha ha! You missed! Oh great master.
Hello 2000. I'm home.
(OC) Happy New Year, naked weirdo!
Happy new year.
Well, we'll never know where the ass guy went, and since we can't kill him, I say live and let live.
Aww, that's sweet boss. Fry'll be nice and cozy back in the year 2000.
What?! How do you know he went to the year 2000?
That's where he always goes.
Hmm. Better play it safe. Go there a little earlier and wait for him. You know what to do.
You want me to concludify him, like some sort of dispatcherator?
Yes. And don't forget to terminate him.
Got it. Preparing to terminate Philip Fry!
What's with the doofy sun glasses?
It's really bright in the past. [Recites the time code]
Ok, Fry. Come ta poppa. ... Man I'm bored. [spots beer] Ohhh!

Character: [Bender drinks the 5 cans left in the 6 pack from SP3000]

Line: Hey, there you are! ... Oh, wait, that's Fry before he goes to the future. I'm waiting for the one who comes back from the future. Geesh this is confusing, and I bet it's gonna get a lot more confusing. Offf. That cheap beer really goes right through you. For the first time ever, I gotta use the bathroom, but if I leave, I might miss Fry. Ohhhh unless ....
... and I bet it's gonna get a lot more confusing. Huh! Ah! Wha?
Hi, I'm you from 19 seconds in the future. Stay here and wait for Fry while I go to the bathroom.
Ok Boss. After I kill Fry you're next.
What?
Nothing.
What the? Who are you?
I'm Bender from way at the end. I came back to put this rub-on time code on Fry's ass.
So what are you now, a butler? Spot of tea please, jerkwad!
It's called class, you yokel. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a buttocks to tattoo.
Hello 2000. I'm home.
(OC) Happy New Year, naked weirdo!
Happy new year.
Hasta la vista, meatbag!
Bender? What are you doing? It's me, your best friend.
Must obey orders. Ohhhhh. Mustn't kill friend!! Ohhhhhh!!! Badly want to urinate!!!!!
What's happening? Are you urinating?
[monotone] Entering auto destruct sequence. [normal] Awww crap, I hate auto destruct sequence! [monotone] Explosion in seven, six, ...
It'll be a cold day in hell my friend.
[monotone] five .. [normal] Hey, I'm supposed to be the one saying cool things!

Hey ... so the game of cat and mouse begins, huh? Let us match wits. .... Ohhhh, how am I supposed to find him? All those times he blabbed on and on about his life in the twentieth century. If only I'd paid the slightest bit of attention. Oh well, guess I'd better go kill myself.
Hello, bartender? I have thought it over, and far from being a fat pig, you are very nice and I would like another drink ...

Take a barf buddy. Ok suicide booth, give me your best shot. Electrocution please, side order of poison. [taps foot] Helloooo? Kill me you stupid machine. ... What the ... local calls fifty cents? It's a street corner telephone parlor! Oh what kind of horrible suicide free time is this? Wait a minute, maybe this handy encyclopedia of humans will help me track Fry down.
One of these Frys must be Fry. Look out Philip Fry, 'cause I got a little present for you.
My name is Phillip Fry. Where's my present.
Hang on a second Fry. I don't remember you being that ugly.
Oh no, I've always been this ugly.
Huh. Let me see your ass. [He looks at the fat man's buttocks.] No tattoo. Okay, you can go.
Farewell sir.
Say your prayers, Fry.
This isn't Fry. I kicked Fry out two hours ago. This is my new boyfriend ... uhhh ...
Constantine.
Really? That's a dumb name. Ewwww.
Hmmm, could be a trick. Let me see your ass, Constantine. [He looks at Constantine's buttocks.] Ohh, nice, now I see why she left Fry.
Okay, you're still clean. I mean metaphorically.
He must have left the city. Man, this could take all day.
The returns are looking good, Mr. Gore.
Thanks, Phil. Here's to four years of clean air, clean government, and amazing new technologies such as ...
... ROBOT!
[racking pump on gun] Philip Fry?

Character: [Al Gore points to Phil. Bender chases Phil out of the room, destroying the bin labeled "Gore" in the process.]

Line: Twelve years passed. Then ...
... this.
Philip J. Fry?
Phil, some kind of trash can here to see you. He's coming.
Are you made of Tinkertoy?
Hmmm. It's been twelve years. Maybe I'm getting taller.
You're not getting smarter.
Listen, pipsqueak, are you Philip J. Fry or not? 'Cause if you are, I'm here to kill you.
I'd like to see you try.
[screams] You want Uncle Phil. He went to the North Pole on a fishing boat.
Ahhhh! The North Pole? I was just there.

One ticket to the North Pole, please, broom closet class. [Gasps as a bearded figure descends a boarding ramp from a ship] Fry? If only I could be sure. [The figure's pants sag, revealing the Bender tattoo] It is him, I'd recognize me, and hence him, anywhere.
Follow that guy. There's an extra hundred in it for you if you follow him so close that you run him over.
(cab driver) Yes sir.
Dang. That hundred dollars could have bought me one gallon of gas.

Ohhh! I lost him. People will call me a failure. [sees Fry in a second floor window] Others however will call me the world's sexiest killing machine who's fun at parties. Fry, old buddy, it's me, Bender.
Wooo! I totally killed him. [laughs then cries] Oh god, what have I done?
Preparing to terminate Philip Fry.
What's with the doofy sun glasses?
It's really bright in the past.
[crying] Mission accomplished.
Fry is dead?
No other robot could have done it. It took twelve years of tireless stalking but I hunted down and killed my best friend. [cries] I'm the greatest.
Time code and obedience virus erased.
Huh?
Also, fifty terabytes of porn.
Hey!
You've got no porn, no code, and you're ugly! Let's dance!
Now it's true we'll all miss Fry.
He was the only one of you who never struck me.
And we'll never see if boyish smile and hair horn again. But I bet he went back to his own time. I'm sure he was very happy and lived to a ripe old age.
He wasn't and he didn't!
Struggling alone again incredible odds, I, Bender, managed to kill him. [cries] I blew him to mush like a midget in a microwave. [cries]
Awww, don't blame yourself, Bender.
I don't blame myself, I blame all of you.
Us?! How can you possibly blame us?
It ain't easy. It just proves how great I am. [breaks down and cries] Ohhh, Fry, I'd give anything to unmurder you!
Did someone call me?
No. [gasps] Fry? [runs to Fry] But ... I killed you in 2012. Unless ...
Ooph!
Nope, he's not a zombie.
Welcome back Fry.
[sarcastic] Thank you, Lars.
[to Leela] I .. ah ... I .. I'll see you later, honey.
So tell us Fry. If Bender killed you centuries ago, how in Satan's glorious name did you return?
Ohh, it's an astonishing tale of incredibleness. It all began when I went back in time.
Duhhh.
Hey, Mr. Panucci, I'm back from that delivery to the cryogenic lab.
Great. I'll put you on the cover of Big Whoop magazine!
Mmmm, I'm starving. Can I have a slice?

Character: [Panucci take a slice of pizza from the garbage and puts it on the counter]

Line: Help yourself. Cash up front.

Character: [Fry pull out his wallet that only had future money in it]

Line: This note is legal tender.
(VO) Unfortunately, I had no money from that era. But that's when it hit me - I knew where to find free pizza.
[groans] Ohh, ice cold.
(VO) That's when it hit me again ...
But an hour ago this pizza's still luke warm. [unzips pants and reads time code off his ass] Zero zero one one zero ...
(OC) [monotone] Explosion in seven, six ...

Character: [In background Fry-2 kicks Bender into the cryotube]

Line: It'll be a cold day in hell my friend.
[monotone] five .. [normal] Hey, I'm supposed to be the one saying cool things!
Nice kick, me.
Thanks. What are you doing here?
One hour from now, I travel back in time for free pizza.
But Nibbler said not to use the time code.
Fine, Mr. Responsible, don't use the code. Mmmmm. That pizza sure was good.
You pig.
Whatever.
(VO) That's when it hit me yet a third time ...
[slaps himself on the forehead] You idiot, frozen me's still got a wallet full of old timey money.

Character: [Fry goes to tube #40, opens the door, and reaches around frozen Fry, touching his ass on the tattoo.]

Line: Yuck, I touched my own butt.

Character: [Fry slips on the overturned chair and falls into the cryotube]

Line: So I unfroze ten minutes ago and I walked over here and then it was now and then I don't know what happened.
Well, I'm glad you're alive, but I don't want people to say I'm incompetent so I better kill you again. Hold still.
Bender! Stop killing for a minute. The Fry you murdered was doomed anyway. See?

Character: [Fansworth switches on a holo projector in his belt buckle which shows the equations from his lab backboard.]

Line: What'd ya got there? Numbers?
When the time code duplicates a living thing, the copy is always doomed. And that includes flabby Jamaican potbellies.
Kiss my front butt.
So my copy lives twelve years before Bender murdered him?
Brutally murdered.
I wonder what his life was like?
I guess we'll never know.
Or will we?
Nope.
They won't know, but you will. Lucky you.
Oh hey Mr. Panucci, I'm back from the delivery to the cryogenic lab.
I know. I read about it in Big Whoop magazine.
So ... uh ... my girlfriend kicked me out. Can I rent the upstairs storage room?
The upstairs storage? [Laughs] I like you kid. Your lousy life makes me feel good about myself. The room's yours. Here, take some rat spray for the meat ball hamper.
Happy day, mon! It's good to have you back.
Indeed, but the scammers will soon sprunje the code again. We must remove the time tattoo at once, and as painlessly as possible.
Hurry, they're coming.
There, the code is gone. I saved the space-time continuum and forty percent of your rectum.
That's all you need.
I sprunje code.
Too late, Nudar. I've wiped Fry's butt clean.
[sniffing] We'll see about that.
Nothing boss. We sprunjed his ass inside and out.
The only information we found was a hair shaped like the number six.
[taking hair] Give me that. [eats hair] mmm. Nine. Alright, let him go, I guess the time code really is gone.
Thank god. The present may stink, but at least now we can look forward to a better yesterday.
I'm sorry Leela, I can't keep living in the past, by which I mean the future. I'll always love you, but I've got to move on and find my life's purpose.
... and that how Bundles the monkey finally found a friend.
I miss Morbo.

And finally tonight on the late, cute animal news, a story that will really tug your heartstrings, way more than bundles, the doll-raping monkey. It's the tale of lonely Leelu, the little orphan narwhal.
Awww.

(on TV) Leelu is a rare, toothed female narwhal who got disoriented and washed up in Atlantic City, as we all do from time to time. But without a mother, she's lost the will to eat. [offering bottle to Leelu] Come on, take a sip.
I know how to make things eat. Maybe this is my purpose in life.
Hi, I'd like to apply for a job working with Leelu.
Question number one, do you have any experience working with marine mammals?
No, but I think they're pretty neat.
That answers question number two. Question number three, do you know where the door is or would you prefer to be kicked out?
I don't know. I guess kicked out.
Hiya girl. My name's Fry, and I think you're a cutie 'cause I like things that have only one thing instead of two things.
Holy mackerel, she's eating whole mackerel. I don't know what your secret is but if you'll work for minimum wage you can start tomorrow.
If I work of less than minimum, can I start today?
I don't see why not.

(on TV) In business news, the weak and gullible inhabitants of Earth were plunged into economic depression today as the scammer aliens finished stealing every item of value, including ownership of this station.
(on TV) [laughs]
Tough times earth chumps. We're repossessing your TV. Seems you can't afford it now that you're unemployed.
We're not unemplo --
I love the hard museum at night. It's where I come to be alone.
Hi Lars.
Ah, Lars and la belle Leela. I trust you brought some haute cuisine for an old Frenchman.
You're favorite General, Torgo's Executive Powder.
Mmmm. Magnifique.
Come on Leela, let me show you the hall of screaming skulls.
It's so romantic. [turns away from Lars and cries]
What's wrong? Is the screaming depressing you?
It's just ... my life is changing so fast. I don't know who I am anymore.
I know who you are. You're the woman I've been waiting for all my life.
Let's go to my place.
I ... like what you've done with it.
[reading from a sign on the fence] "All tenants evicted, signed new owners"?
That would be us, dump cakes. We're buying the whole city and turning it into a private panda hunting reserve.  Na-na-na!!
There aren't any Pandas in New New York.
Back it up, Sal!
Look at us, living like trash eating bums in an alley now.
Yes. Now.
And on Xmas eve, the most wonderful night of the [Bender trips him] ooofff.
Oops.
Well, at least we have each other, so it truly is the worst Xmas ever.
[pointing] Santa!
Ah, the Planet Express crew. According to my list [Bender mimicking] you've all been very naughty. I'll be back for you after I collect my milk and cookies from starving orphans.
That's it. I don't see how things could get any worse.
We could sing.
I'd rather kill myself.
Why not do both?
Oh, very well.

Character: [Farnsworth climbs onto a door step with effort.

Line: [Singing]

Character: Those sleazy naked scammers make me look like a chump.

Line: [off camera] Neh!
[singing]

Character: They robbed me of my dignity

Line: [singing] Lars brought me candy.

Character: Fry, Amy, Zoidberg, Bender, Tinny Tim, and Nibbler
Line: [singing] Cram it down and shut the hell up!
[singing] I can't compete with that.
[singing]

Character: Who would choose a backwards corpse

Line: [singing] Lars says I'm dreamy.

Character: Fry, Zoidberg, Amy, Tinny Tim, Bender, Farnsworth
Line: [singing] Who the hell cares?
[singing]

Character: Oh, won't somebody shoot her please
And put her out of our misery?

Line: [at head of alley holding weapons] That's my cue.
Oh my word!
[watching Lars and Leela hugging across the alley, singing]

Character: I bet she'd love me too
If I was a blad headed kook.

Line: Hey, guess what guys!
What?
[singing]

Character: While we were huddled in fear,

Line: [singing] Congratulations!
[singing] Mazel tov!
[singing] May stars in heaven bless your love!
[singing]

Character: 'Cause it's an extra happy Xmas this year!

Line: Now could things get any worse.
Ho! Ho! Ho.
Stop screaming. That's just what the bomb wants us to do.
I say do what it tells us. [screams and clacks claws]
Don't worry, a bomb in a case is just like a head in a jar.
[hugging Lars] Oh Lars! No blowing us up make me love you even more.
[grumbling] Life saving goody goody ...
Well now that death has been staved off momentarily, let me be the first to say congratulations Leela and Lars.
[raising hand] Maid of honor!
[raising claw an instant later] Maid of honor! Ohhh.
[quietly] I could make you happy too, if only you'd give me a chance.
You've done a wonderful job, Fry. When you first started, I thought she'd be dead within a narweek, which is six days I believe.
Nah. Leelu's a champ. She just needed someone to show her how to eat. [Fry-2 tosses a fish into his mouth, and another into Leelu's mouth]
Now that the kind of whale behavioral science they don't teach you in whale behavioral science class.
So what's up, Dr. Schlovinowitz?
[sighs] This is a little hard for me to say Fry. You see, it's ... it's time we released Leelu back into the wild.
I'm sorry. The decision is final. Plus we need the tank for the Loch Ness monster.
But that turned out to be a log with a Halloween mask stapled to it.
Yes, well, it still draws a crowd.
[crying] I can't let this happen, she'll never be happy without me.
I know you're broke and homeless but you still want a swank wedding reception so I whipped you up some real nice budge appetizers.
[tasting one] Mmmm. I can keep these down.
Okay! That's a big "yes" on the crud puffs. Try the shlimp cocktail.
There must be some way I can stop this wedding. What if I steal the wedding ring?
Already taken care of. [Bender displays a diamond ring on his finger]
You think that'll be enough to stop the ceremony.
Nope. I pulled the old switcheroo, so they won't even know the difference. Wait a minute, I think the copy I made cost more than this.
Cheap lousy Lars.
[examining the ring through a jeweler's loupe] Actually this is extremely nice, but I really went all out on the copy. It was sorta my gift to them.
I can't let this happen. She'll never be happy without me.
It's not fair, we need each other.
Fry, you dumb sack, I don't care about your problems at all! [coughs]
You need your blanket Mr. Panucci.
I don't even want to be here. I only came 'cause you wheeled me. But if that narwal means so much to you, you gotta do something.
I know. But I can't just go chasing after her. That'd be nuts.
Ah, Sometimes you gotta be a little nuts. Let me introduce you to my cousin. He owns a small freighter. That's him, right behind us.
[to Panucci] Maybe you're right. [to Panucci's cousin] Sir, I'd like to engage your ship for a trans-Arctic voyage to capture a Narwhal and bring it back to my room.
The mans is nuts, Leroy.
Professional whale keeper, eh? I've carried your type before and we don't get along. Oh, I agree with your values and your goals and your methods, but somehow we just never click on a personal level.
I'm not a professional anymore. Just a narwal loving private citizen.
Then I'm you man. We'll take on three barrels of fresh sausage and sail at dawn.
[dramatically] Welcome to the wedding.
[to Bender] It's a fool proof plan. They can't sign the wedding license if I give them a pen with no ink. [laughs and exchanges pens]
Yeah, once they try to sign that license, all hell will break look. [rolls eyes up, muttering] Oy vey.
Go on now, mon, don' cha' know nothin' about zippin' up a woman's frock?
[struggling with the zipper on LaBarbara's dress] It's more my thing to zip 'em down. [laughs]
Get your clumsy, muscular hands off my woman, Barbados.
Hermes! Your body!
I always said you were a little backward.
Well, I always said you were a little forward ... with my wife.
ohhh!
[zips up LaBarbara frock] Consider yourself bird dogged.
That's my man. Take a boat, Barbados.
Brother, you gots to tell that sweet thing your time duplicate body is doomed.
Tomorrow morning. After the "festivities".
[nudging Hermes and spinning a basketball on his finger] Yow, baby!

Character: [The Robot Devil band plays the wedding march, Leela enters escorted by the Professor with Nibbler scattering flower petals in front of them]

Line: [from a grating beneath the asile] Our little girl is finally getting married. And to a normal two eyed human.
Eh, he's not good enough for her. Leela deserves a guy with a dozen eyes.
Quit trying to fix her up with Fly Mutant. [A humanoid with large fly eyes behind them buzzes and licks fluid off one eye]

Dearly liked, we are gathered here before one or more gods, or fewer, to joining this couple in pretty good matrimony. If anyone objects to this union, let them speak now or forever hold their piece, or do something else.
It's been two years, Fry. We've caught a hundred and eight narwhals and set them all free again.
None of them were Leelu.
But all of them were edible.
[pointing] Can we at least eat that one? I'm sick of sausage.
[looking through binoculars, gasps] I'd know that modified extended tooth anywhere. To the boats!
Leelu! Leelu! It's me, Fry.
[hugging Leelu] Oh, I've missed you too, Leelu. But we'll never be apart again because we care too much for each other. Fire!
Now, if the couple will sign the wedding license.
I warned him. I warned him a time paradox duplicate is always doomed.
[surprised] What?
Oh, no, my man! He's essentially dead again.
Relax ma'am. Your husband's original body will be repaired within one week.
Nah uh uh. Not soon enough. Boy needs a daddy.
Cruel runnings, mon. [laughs]
Woopsy-doopsy, poopsy.
Well, let's get on with it. Don't let my doomed body and my doomed marriage stand in the way of your happiness.
No, it's not right. We don't want our happy day tainted by misfortune and tragedy, do we?
I'm OK with it.
No, it's not right. The wedding is off.
Oh my goodness! [starts stealing the wedding gifts]
[snickering] Finally, a happy ending.
[voice over] And now it's time for Everybody Loves Hypnotoad.
Even in a depression, the entertainment industry thrives.
Are you okay, Leela?
Yeah, I'm just a little down 'cause the only man I'll ever love left me at the altar. Plus I live in a dumpster.
[angry] You stay out of my dumpster!
We interrupt this episode of Everybody Loves Hypnotoad to bring you a special address from Earth President Nixon.
Please, Hypnotoad, it's beyond my control. No! Don't make me kill myseIf!
My fellow Earthicans, I'm about to close a deal that will allow us to buy Earth back from the scammers.
That'll teach those scammers and me.
Just when things looked darkest, I received an e-mail from the Andrrrrrrromeda Galaxy. lt seems we've won their quadrillion-dollar family sweepstakes!
Oh, Lord.

So assuming all goes ... [Headless Body of Agnew grunts] What's that, Agnew? A telegram? [reads telegram] Baroo! There ... seems to have been some ... We've been scammed again, people. Prepare to evacuate Earth. I mean, New Scamadonia.
[Singing] Na-na-na-na, Na-na-na-na, Hey, hey, hey, We took your stuff!, etc.
All aboard for Neptune!
Oh, I don't want to go to Neptune.
Thanks for the planet, suckers.
It's so cold, my processor is running at peak efficiency.
What are you, a whining machine? lf you want to worry about something, worry about the Yetis.
Yetis? [Yetis growl from outside] Oh, Yetis.
Don't mess with me, you ice-crapping snow-honkies. I just got dumped.
Sweet Yeti of the Serengeti, she's gone crazy eddie in the head-y.
Is that normal?
No. Perhaps if we were to cook and eat her slightly...
Leave her alone. She just needs me to cheer her up. Wanna sword fight, girl?
That male narwhal seems to be upsetting her. Get us out of here, Captain. Full fast ahead.
Damn whale keepers.
Santa! We forgot he's based on Neptune.
[Holding a missile launcher] Ho. Ho. Ho...
What happened, Santa?
Can you imagine the harm they could do with that information? I wanted to do that harm!
That's it. They've gone too far. It's time to fight back.
Now, let's not resort to violence, Leela.
We're fighting back and you're helping us, you fat holiday idiot.
That hurt. You're on the naughty list!
So that's our proposal napkin, Mr. President. We have just enough people and ships to mount a ragtag attack.
You wish, missy. Dog-danged scammers used our money to build a fleet of remote-controlled, solid-gold Death Stars.
Ooh! I'd take one of those with a side of chili fries.
We're hopelessly outgunned. The Force is with us, but that's about it.
Ah, but we have access to a huge manufacturing complex.
[singing]

Character: I brought the elves back from vacation,
Chained them up, and called my holiday friends ...

Line: Kwanzabot
[singing] And the Chanukah zombie.
[singing]
[singing] Damn you!  Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]

Character: Now fetch those bunnies by the armful.

Line: [singing] Says who? Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]

Character: Napalm makes them slightly more harmful.
No one here goes near that door,

Line: [singing]

Character: Low-down scammers got me seeing red.
Got my TIE fighter out of the hangar,
Jump back, Jack 'cause I'm Jewish and I'm undead.

Line: [singing] Ten hut! Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]

Character: I made it out of blasting clay

Line: [singing] You're nuts. Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]

Character: And when it's dry and ready,
I can't wait eight nights or more,

Line: [rapping, while Robot Santa beatboxes]

Character: So the children won't miss it.
But I know it when they diss it.

Line: [singing] Yeah, K?
[singing] CZ?
[singing] Hey, hey.
[rapping]
[singing]
Can they sue for liability?
Certainly not!
[singing] Use as much as you are able.
[singing] This bites. Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]
[singing] Now, let's fight.
[singing, simultaneously] Let's fight.
Doo, doo, doodoo!
[singing]
[singing] This trinity's going to war!
Troops, you are now equipped with the finest weapons magical elves can build. As for the battle plan...
And now, to present the battle plan, Commander Zapp Brannigan!
What?
At ease, people. I was redecorating my undisclosed location when I received word of an heroic invasion. Kif, crouch down and shield my thighs from the cold, for God's sake.

We fight this battle, not for ourselves, but for our children and our children's children. Which is why I'm forming a children's brigade. Will the following youths please step forward? Cubert Farnsworth.
Here, sir!
My boy. Oh, God, no!
Dwight Slim.
Here.
You took his name? Oh, God, no! In several ways!
Assuming the 15th pile of children buys us a few seconds, we will then execute maneuver 45. Followed by maneuver 44.
Forty-six.
Oh, great. Now I have to start back at the beginning with maneuver two.
One.
Admiral, will we stop attacking at any point or is this one of those phony-baloney, feel-good wars like the war on drugs?
What's your name, smart mouth?
Lars Fillmore.
Ah, the lovely Leela's on-again, off-again paramour. Perhaps a suicide mission would knockthe insubordination out of you.
Yes, yes, yes.
We're approaching Earth, sir.

Who? Oh, planet Earth. The big blue velour marble. All commanders stand by. Prepare to transfer battle control to the main duper-computer on my mark! Ten, nine, eigh---[A Solid Gold Death star turns visible and shoots the Nimbus]
Does anybody mind if I take command?
No.
Nos.
Nah.
Nope.
No, Miss Turanga.
No, I do not.
No.
It's cool.
Argh!
All right. Unit one, acquire target A and fire!
Yes! Nailed the children's ship.
Bingo!
Cheating son of a...
Whoa! Whoa! Whoa!
It's hopeless! I can't coordinate this many ships!
Perhaps I can help! Professor, can you wire my head directly into the battle grid?
I can wire anything directly into anything. I'm the professor!
Then prepare to see a bureaucrat's brain in action.
[Flying through a vent firing] Finally, I get to save the Earth with deadly lasers instead of deadly slide shows.
He's champing for a clamping!
Kwa-zang!
I did it! I saved Earth and won back my woman. Right, woman?
Oh, Hermes, I've been such a fool.
You haven't seen the last of Barbados Slim! Now, goodbye forever.
Remember this, Farnsworth?
Farnsworth? That's me! My doomsday device! So it was the scammers! They sawed off my hand and stole the doomsday device.
lt wasn't them. lt was me, Bender. The master criminal!
So what'll it be? - Unconditional surrender?
Never!
Or totaI destruction?
Also never!
You have 30 seconds. Make up your minds!
[Melodramatically] Nevvveeeeer!

People, I'm sorry. You've never before heard me say those words, or even the individual letters that make them up. But I am. And with a huge amount of modesty, I humbly beg your forgiveness. [Bender pulls out a satchel of the Spheroboom, opens it, and drops it in the Axillary Torpedo slot]
Uh-oh. I have a worrisome shriveling sensation in my sprunjer.
Yay! Bender!
All right!
Bender, how the Hulk did you end up with the doomsday device?

I was working the long con all along. While sawing off the professor's hand with an extremely dull saw, I had some time to think. So I asked myself, "Who could use a doomsday device more? The scammers or me, Bender?". After several minutes of sawing, I knew the answer. Me, Bender. So I retrieved the dummy satchel ...
(VO) ... and as soon as I was out of the scammers' control, I pulled the old switcheroo.
And that's how I saved Earth and am the greatest!
Bender the robot, I'm proud to present you Earth's highest award for swindling. The Dirty Double-Cross.
I'll aways treasure it and immediately hock it.
There, your body's good as new. Just pop in an executive suppository every few...
What is it?
Nothing.
It's supposed to be a celebration, Leela. I mean, come on. Whimmy-wham-wham-whazle!
I can't help it. I was gonna be married. I was so happy.
Well, maybe you'll meet someone else someday.
No, you don't understand. Lars is the only man I'll ever love. I know it in my heart.
You remember when we first met?
Uh-huh. lt was right there in the cryogenic lab, eight years ago today.
Meet me there in five minutes. It's important.
Why are you so sad, Leelu?
Him again? [sudden realization strikes] Wait a second, are you two...
Atanarjuat, Fufu, come here! We have to set Leelu free.
Dang. I never should have quit my job at the casino.
Me, neither. But she needs what'll make her happy, not what'll make me happy.
Goodbye, Leelu.
I don't much know about frozen heads, but, of course, if it's Mahatma Gandhi, I'll... Leela?
Lars?
I... I really have to go, I...
Fry, was this an idiotic trick to get Lars and me back together?
Quite idiotic. But you don't need to be an idiot to see that you two belong together. And, Leela,I want what'll make you happy, not what'll make me happy.
I'm sorry, I really am, but Leela and I just can't be married.
Why not? You obviously love each other. What are you, cousins?
Fry, you deserve to know the truth. It's because...
Nobody move!
Nudar! How did you survive the doom blast?
My doom-proof platinum vest absorbed most of the radiation. In retrospect, I wish I'd been wearing doom-proof pants, but you know us nudists. Now give me the time code!
I don't have it! Nibbler heat-blasted it off my butt.
Not you.
You!
Lars? He doesn't have it. He never had it. Fry had it!
But Nibbler heat-blasted it off my butt! I want to stress that part!
My throbbing sprunjer says otherwise. Now where is it?
I'm not afraid of you or your expensive gun! Go ahead and shoot!
Oh, yeah? Then what if I kill the woman you love?
Don't you understand, numb-neck? He doesn't love me!
[crying] I've... always loved you. Don't hurt her. I'll give you the code.
What the...
[monotone] Four, three, two, [normal voice] one, Boom! [Nothing happens. Bender-2 laughs] Woah!
Lars, no!
[Looking at a picture of Leelu] It's enough just to know you're happy.
[Looking at a picture of Leela and crying] You, too. It's enough to know you're happy with Lars.
Fry, old buddy! It's me! Bender! [Bender fires his gun]
My hair!
My larynx!
I'm Lars?  I'm Lars!
Wait for me, Leela! I'll be there in a thousand years.

[On a screen] So I got a job at the Head Museum and waited for the wonderful day when Leela would arrive. Everything was perfect until Hermes exploded at our wedding. That's when I learned that, as a time paradox duplicate, I, too, was doomed. I couldn't put Leela through that. So I called it off. I'm sorry, Leela.
[sad] I understand.
That concludes another Silly Willy Wideo Will!
He was a good man, Leela.
Yeah... you were.
Well, I guess that wraps everything up in a nice, paradox-free bow.
Not quite, my wrinkly brother.
Right on! In order for any of this to make any sense at all, someone must make one final trip back in time to put the code on Fry's ass in the first place!
Sounds like a job for me, Bender.
Zero, zero, one, one, zero, zero...
Mission accomplished!
You put the time code on my ass?

Someone's ass. Oh, and guess what? I met all these really cool guys with treasure down in the limestone cavern, so I invited them to stick around instead of coming up when they were logically supposed to.
No! No! Everyone out of the universe! Quick!
What's the worst that can happen?
Well, we're boned.

Line: 0 - Wernstrom  1." A ball heads down a wall toward him.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Character: Colleen (with two beers in her hands)
Line: Woo hoo! Bust those balls!

Line: Hooray! We're equally good! [He is run over from behind by a ball.]

Line: Come on, Bender! Your grandmother could push harder than that!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: No crap. My grandmother was a bulldozer.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: And thus metal man defeated meat man. The end.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Come here, winner!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Character: Colleen (looking at one of Wernstrom players)
Line: Come here, loser! [She kisses him.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Colleen, what are you doing? My face is over here.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: This is my boyfriend, silly!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: I thought I was your boyfriend.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: You are.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Well, how can you have two boyfriends?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Oh, I don't. I have five. [Three more men walk in and stand next to Chu.] Fry, meet Chu, Bolt, Ndulu, and Shlomo.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Nihow.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Greetings.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Pleasure.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: But... But...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Shlomo and Ndulu will help you move your stuff into my apartment tonight.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Welcome to the relationship, buddy!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Hmm? [He spits a piece of butterscotch into his hand.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: There's my butterscotch.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Congratulations, Deathballers! We've won the right to explore the anomaly!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: What? I thought I was playing for my freedom!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: No. [He inserts a crank and turns it to power a hologram of the Anomaly.] Now, I've often said "good news" when sending you on a mission of extreme danger. So when I say this anomaly is dangerous, you can imagine how dangerous I really think it is.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Not dangerous at all?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Actually, quite dangerous indeed.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: That is quite dangerous!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Indeed. Now stop shilly-shallying! Prep the ship and line up for your pre-flight coffee enemas!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Warning. The enema you are about to enjoy is extremely hot.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: I don't know what to do, Leela. Should I move in with Colleen and her four other boyfriends?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: What are you going to do? Sleep in a big pile like hamsters?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: No! It's not like that. Everyone gets his own room and a shelf in the refrigerator.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Take the deal, Fry! If there's a delicious cake, isn't it better to have one slice than none at all? Even if four other guys eat the other four slices, and they're all thrusting their sweaty naked bodies against the cake?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Only one thing matters, Fry. Do you really love Colleen, like I love my little squeezle? [She squeezes him and his head expands and eyes expand out of his head. He giggles.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yeah. I do love her.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Then things will work out. [Amy lets go of him and he contracts to normal size, but one eye remains out. Amy pokes it and it pops back to normal size.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Whoa!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Double espresso for Philip Fry?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Sorry, I'm not going on the mission. I'm moving in with Colleen!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Good for you, Fry.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Hooray!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Alright!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: I'll just take that to go. [He is poured a coffee and it's handed to him.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yay! [She hugs Fry.] Welcome to your new home!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Thanks, Colleen. And listen, I'm sorry I got jealous before. [They walk through the doors.] I'm just happy to be here with you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Want a slice of delicious cake?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: (Gasps) The anomaly!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: It's so anomalous.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: I'm feeling dread deep in my dreads!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Wernstrom!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yes, and I'm afraid I have disturbing news about the anomaly. You see...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: How did you get this number? Hermes, hang up on him in the rudest possible manner.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yes, sir! [He drops his pants and grasps the phone between his buttocks.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: No, not the crack slam! [Hermes slams the phone down and the screen goes to static.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Oh, my life rocks. [She pours the wine into six glasses.] I've got good wine, five sweethearts, and today, I was promoted to Chief of Police.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Here's to you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Me?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: No, Colleen. I'm making a romantic toast.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Sorry.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: You have the most beautiful eyes I think I...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Thank you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: I'm not talking to you!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Then I am not talking to you, either.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Will everyone be quiet a little? I want to hear what he has to say!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Thank you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Not you, you Verstinkener. You're just here 'cause she likes cave men from the stupid ages.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Oh, look who's talking. You're just here 'cause she got matzoh fever.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: So, what's the explanation for you, moron fever? (laughs)

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Enough! All of you! I love you. Most people in this world don't have what we have. Let's just be grateful, okay?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yeah.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Yeah, you're right.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: So, Colleen, you look really nice.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Oh, thanks. I got dressed up for my date. [A car horn honks. Colleen runs toward the door.] There he is. Don't wait up!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: That's it. I thought I was okay with this, but I'm not. I'm breaking up with you! [Musical score is played. Colleen looks as Fry sadly and he retains his anger.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Me?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Why are we risking our lives? Can't we just send in a robotic drone? [He looks over at the crew, who are expectedly staring back at him.] What's everybody looking at me for?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: "Let's send a robot to explore it. 'Cause you can always buy another one for 20 bucks."

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Really?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Well, it's 30 bucks, and there's a $10-mail-in rebate. When the League of Robots hears about this, they won't be pleased. Oh, you'll pay, my darlings.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: The League of Robots doesn't exist, tin mon. It's just a cartoon for babies.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Oh, yeah? Then how come when I was a kid, I had a whole sticker book of them? [She airlock doors shut and Bender's voice is muffled.] Answer that with your precious logic.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 1
Line: Bender to crew. I have reached the gateway to another universe. I feel awed and strangely humbled by the momentous solemnity of this occasion. (yelling) Hey, other universe, bite my shiny metal... [He thrusts his ass into the anomaly, but he and the ship are shot away from it by a pink blast. Everybody is screaming and bricks fall out of Bender.]

The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I can't remember anything except a blinding light and a searing ass pain. I better check my black box. BENDER  "The light! It's blinding! And the ass pain! It's searing!" So that's what happened.
