Line: Hey, Bender! Look who's here to cheer you up.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I don't need cheering up. I'm perfectly...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Greetings, sick fan.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: (Gasps) TV's Calculon! (He coughs)

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [Paparazzi's take pictures of Calculon through the open door. He walks over to Bender's side and knees down.] You poor, mangled husk of what was once a robot! What right hath fate to pluck a sweet, dimple-cheeked mechanism in the flower of his youth? And... Scene! There, that was some free acting for you. [He walks toward the door.] Ordinarily, to see acting like that, you'd have to sit through a tampon commercial.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Where did we go wrong, Fry? We were meant to be together!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Nu, I'm freezing my tokhes off here.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Just a sec, honey!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I'm back, idiots! [They all cheer.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You look wonderful, robut! I wish I could afford to go to a hospital. I'm dreadfully sick. [He sneezes a green mucus all over the table in front of him.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: (laughs) I feel great, and I owe it all to Calculon. [He removes his wheels and hangs them on the coat rack.] His visit really inspired me. [He walks over to the Conference Table.] I finally know what I want to be when I grow up.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You want to co-star in his TV show? Like that time you already did that?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: No. I'm gonna be a stalker!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: That's not really a career. More of a felony.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Man, I'm gonna stalk his brains out. [He types on the keyboard in front of Farnsworth.] Ooh! Big news on the Calculon fan site! There's a flash mob headed for his plastic surgeon's office!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: There, that's as big as I can make it. But I caution you, it looks completely unrealistic.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You let me worry about that! Just do your job.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Character: [The door slams open with Bender and other clamouring photographers snapping pictures of Calculon's pride.] Dear God, no!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Neat! [He takes a photo.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Get a shot of that.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh boy, oh boy, he's here. [A crowd is flooding in the doors.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Calculon, I love you! Have my baby!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Back, you lunatic! [He pushes her face and she falls over.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: He touched me!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Sign my ass! [He pulls out his ass plate and a pen as Calculon dashes off with a blanket. Surrounded by the mob, be grabs the surgeon and hurls him at the crowd. Crashes are heard. Bender groans.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Emergency! Emergency! Everyone to the Calamitorium! [Leela, Hermes, Amy and Zoidberg rush in. Zoidberg is whooping.] Leela, smell this.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Can I wipe it off first?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: No time, woman! No time!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Hmm. Smells like angel dust. [She pulls off the spouts and a "pop" is heard.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Exactly! That's a discontinuous electromagnetic field. Wernstrom tried to warn me, but I was too damn stubborn! Hermes, get Wernstrom on the line so I can apologize.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Ogden Wernstrom speaking.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Tell him I'm not here!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Professor!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh, very well. Wernstrom, I've been a vainglorious fool! If you can find it in your heart to forgive me, your tiny little heart, would you consider a scientific collaboration?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Sir, I'd be honored. [He stands up from his chair to reveal he is wearing a purple thong.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: As I attempted to warn you, the laws of electromagnetism change abruptly at the anomaly. [He pulls a Pocket Pal out of his lab coat.] Observe.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Play time is fun time.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Character: Wernstrom (while hurling the robot into the anomaly)
Line: Not this time.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: My heavens! If only I'd heeded your warning, I'd have known it was impossible to cross the barrier!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Character: Wernstrom (while opening a barrel labelled "Lab Animals")
Line: But note what happens when I instead throw this laboratory koala. [The Koala gnaws on his sleeve. he tosses the animal into the anomaly, but it passes through unscathed and flies out the window.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: It passed through unharmed. [A thud is heard.] So living beings can enter the other universe, but electrical devices can't?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: My hypothesis exactly.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Then we must mount a second expedition without delay. Right after we blow up more robots.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Agreed.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Play time is fun time.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Who are you?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Bender, your biggest fan.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Are you going to murder me?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Unlikely. In my mind, we're friends. This diorama proves it, see? [He pulls a crudely constructed piece of himself and Calculon playing Ping Pong.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Sir, your derangement is impressive. I'm appointing you my official stalker.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You shan't be disappointed. Pleasant dreams. [Calculon turns the lights off and his eyes close, but Bender's do not. Instead they extend out towards Calculon's eyes. Calculon opens his eyes and looks at Bender's as they quickly move even closer to his own.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Now that I've teamed up with my friend, Dr. (spiteful tone) Wernstrom, (normal tone) I feel certain we can successfully penetrate the other universe.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: It's the greatest scientific opportunity since you yourself sent men to the moon in 1969.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I always regretted that. Nothing up there but dry rocks and those revolting onion men.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: But...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You East Coast intellectuals had your chance. Now beat it! From here on in, this is a military matter.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: People of the universe, please welcome Rear Brigadier Zapp Brannigan.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Thank you, thank you. Well deserved. (To Kif) Kif, stand in that hole so I look taller. [Kif steps into the hole and sighs.] (To crowd) Ever since man first left his cave and met a stranger with a different language and a new way of looking at things, the human race has had a dream. To kill him, so we don't have to learn his language or his new way of looking at things.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Give science a chance!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Less invasions, more equations!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Damn long-hairs. Knock some sense into them, Chief O'Hallahan.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Yes, sir! [She blows a whistle as Smitty, URL and herself run toward the two protestors. The three begin clonking Wernstrom and Farnsworth on the head with night sticks that resemble light sabres. Cut to Fry watching Colleen beat Wernstrom in slow motion. Her helmet falls off and her long hair flies around her head as she goes in for another hit. And another. Cut back to Fry with Leela in a crowd.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I can't take it, Leela. I need to go away. Far away, forever.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Aw, I know how you feel, Fry. There are times when I also feel like you need to go away.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Be careful, my little, teeny, greeny weenie.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: That's just a fungal infection... Oh, she's talking to you, Kif.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Goodbye, my love. [He is pulled away as the ground he stands on move them onto the ship. The engines start up and the Nimbus departs with an escort of heli/hover-copters.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Wow, how come humans get to do all the fun stuff? This is exactly the sort of thing that ought to be handled by (whispering) The League of Robots.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: (He laughs.) That's adorable, Bender. You actually believe in the League of Robots?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You mean, there's really no such thing? Then who's there to mete out justice when an outdated robot is melted into belt buckles? Who's there to defend our honour when a rude human brings a blush to a robo-virgin's cheek?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: No one.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2

Cut to a shot of the Nimbus flying with its escort, zoom into a window labelled "Stowaway Hatch 35
Line: Unauthorized Access Only" to reveal Fry standing in it. He looks back to face Earth and a tear runs down his cheek.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Now that I know robots are worthless, with no League of Robots to protect us from the fleshy menace known as man, I have resolved to kill myself. In lieu of flowers, please beat yourselves in the face with rusty chains. Your friend, Bender.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Ow.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Please select mode of death.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: What the heck, I'll treat myself.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Enemy in range. Prepare to launch universe-to-universe missile.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Hell of a thing to send a universe to certain doom. Fun, though. Makes a man feel big.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Come on, come on, I didn't ask to die of boredom!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You are now dead. Please take your receipt. [A receipt is printed out and it lands on a large pile of other receipts.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: What's... What's happening?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Kneel before the candle.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Don't hurt me! I'll betray anyone!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Bender Bending Rodriguez...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He removes his hood.] Welcome to the League of Robots!

Line: Missile jam. Missile jam.

Line: I heard you the first time, Francine.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Sorry.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2

Line: Quite right, quite so.

Line: Drink the mug! Drink the mug!

Line: Hurray!

Line: Drink the flagon! Drink the flagon!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2

Line: Ready yet, Kif?

Line: That's right, baby!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Hot diggity daffodil!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: And so, to everyone and everything I've ever known, I say my last goodbye.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Hello. So, how are you, Fry?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Pretty good. You?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He is pulled back towards the ship by his elastic legs.] Well... Oh.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Mmm. Kif, get over here. You've got to try this! [He licks the goo off his lips with his tongue.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: At least Kiffy died quickly.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Yes, but according to the Old Farmer's Wikipedia, the amazing thing about Kif's species is that the remains continue suffering for up to six hours after death.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: That's so interesting!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Don't ask where I was last night. For all you know, I was at home, perhaps baking a strudel. What's her problem? Somebody die or something?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Kif's dead, Bender.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Nailed it!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: My condolences, Amy. Allow me to present you with the last known photo of Lieutenant Kroker. [He holds a framed picture in front of her face. Kif is splattered against a wall, rocket in his chest and one arm squished off.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: We so sorry, Mr. and Mrs. Kroker. Terrible shame about Froggy.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Thank you for your kind words.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He sprays a breath mind into his mouth.] Yeah, yeah, real sad. Want some breath spray? Cinnamon flavour, taste like pie. [He sprays both Mr. and Mrs. Kroker once and both of them cough while flying hook worms drop to the ground.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He places a wreath of flowers on Kif's urn labelled "L.O.R."] This is from the league of you-don't-need-to-know.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I am the grand funeral director!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Do you validate parking?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: It is always a terrible tragedy when a swarm outlives its own bulboid. [She grabs Kif's urn.] So it is with great sorrow that I now commit the goo that was once Kif to the petroleum of his ancestors. [She unscrews the jar and turns it over but the goo does not drop out. She shakes it multiple times.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Whack the bottle!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: No, from the bottom ! It works better!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Just stick a butter knife in it!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [She removes the goo with a butter knife.] There, I got most of it. The burial is complete. I will now sing the sacred hymn. It's not part of the ceremony, just a little something that I wrote.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Next!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: It may sound strange, but seeing Kif's mutilated remains poured into the mud made me really sad.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Mutilation is never easy.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I don't think I'll ever love again.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh, you don't mean that. Love can surprise you at any time in your life.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Surprise! [He motions for a kiss with his lips, but Leela punches him in the face with both hands.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Whoa, it kind of takes your breath away. [His Oxygen Pack displays "OXYGEN SYSTEM FAILURE" on the screen accompanied by a beeping noise, but a bolt of lightening quickly blows out the screen.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Look alive, death row. Your saggy asses got a visitor. [He turns off the laser bars.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Regular or conjugal?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He shrugs.] She looked like a freak to me.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: The guard operating the x-ray machine came down with a sudden case of broken neck, so I was able to bring you that delicious cake you wanted. [She pulls a pink, multi-level cake out from under the table, points to her eye and blinks.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I don't understand. Are you winking or blinking?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [She sighs and pulls out a pair of LED glasses that have two eyes on the front. She uses them to wink at the two jailers.] Hang on a second.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Got it!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Ahh, yes, I'm here to repair my horse.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Is the horse's name (whispers) Hot Beans?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: No! I mean, yes.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: So it seems a human had been rather injured by a knife, and as his... As his blood, you know, I think that's what they call it...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Quite correct, sir. Blather on!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: As it drained away, he said... He said, Take me to a dock. No doubt he intended to say doctor, but he was unable to complete his thought, you see, being as he had died. So, taking him at his word, we dragged his corpse to the waterfront, whereupon the seagulls fed upon it.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Humans are dumb and they die easy!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Quite!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Speaking of humans, have I shown you my new monocle? [He holds out his monocle.] Cost me a king's ransom. Made from a king, don't you know!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh, how repulsively decadent!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Yes. But more importantly, it allows me to see the smiling faces of my children for the first time since I lost my vision in that horrible banking accident.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: May I see that for a second? [He grabs it from Billionaire Bot and examines it while walking over to a table.] My, but that's interesting! [He places it on the table and beats it with a fire pit shovel until it bursts, and then some. The other robots are stunned.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I say!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: I'm blind!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: My God, Bender! This is a civilized organization! The rules specifically...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He pulls a book out of his robe titled "Robot's Rules of Order."] May I make a point of order, President Calculon?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Must you?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Yes.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: The bylaws specifically state that no human may set foot in the League of Robots! If he has a human part, he's part human!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh, my! Then I too have a human part I must expel. And I plan to enjoy the experience. Ta-ta !

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Bender, you've rigidly applied the law with no regard for its intent. Well done! You'll go far in this organization.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Oh, you're just gettin' to know Bender. [He taps on his empty glass and Boxy immediately moves from filling Calculon's glass to fill Bender's. Calculon scowls at Bender.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Curses! If we could only turn up the gain, we might smell clear through to the other universe! But we can't adjust it without a screwdriver.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Wait a moment. I think I was just shanked with a screwdriver! [He groans as he yanks a screwdriver out of his back.] Yes!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: A little more. A little less. Heavens to meteoroid! Smell this!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Holy mother of invention!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: We must notify the President at once!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: But how can we? Oh, I wish, I wish, I wish we weren't in prison!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Pazuzu!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: [He lands next to them and they grab onto his front legs.] You have one wish left, Professor.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: Sometimes... Always... Never! You again? This better be damned important. I'm right in the middle of a Cosmo survey!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
Line: You'll want to hear this, Mr. President. For we have sniffed where no man has sniffed before!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 2
The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Look! Up in the sky!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It's a bird!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It's a plane!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I am so out of here! [He flies off screen.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Captain's log, star date, the year of the tiger. The battle has been bravely fought, and the suffering of our troops beyond measure. But the alien is invulnerable, and our defeat inevitable. That much is obvious, even from my remote command post here at the Times Square Applebee's. [Cut to a shot of Zapp sitting in a booth next to a window controlling the Nimbus with a joystick. The anomaly and tentacles can be seen through the window to his left.] Waiter! Take this fried mozzarella back to the kitchen and fry it some more.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Har-harrooo!  The tentacle's coming towards Earth and there's no stopping it. King Kong's too old to save us this time.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: We have only one hope, Mr. President. We must encase the entire planet in a protective sphere of my patented, ultra-hard Diamondium!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Diamondium? (He scoffs.) I could gum through that with my dentures behind my back. My trademarked Diamondillium is twice as hard!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Twice as hard as your head! Which makes it still fairly soft!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Now look here, you Poindexters. I don't care how you decide. Just decide!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Diamondillium it is.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Character: Bender (standing in front of the fireplace)
Line: So, hey, Calculon, I know I'm the new guy, and, pardon my ignorance, but when do we kill all humans?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Never.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: But what about our motto? [A shot of a plaque above the fireplace that says "KILL ALL HUMANS!"] Doesn't it mean anything?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Oh, Bender, your idealism is heart-warming. But the League of Robots hasn't killed a human in over 800 years. And that was a very sick girl scout.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Quite sick indeed.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Sweet, innocent Bender. [He pats Bender on the head and flicks his antenna. Bender looks up at Calculon evilly.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I declare my impenetrable Diamondillium sphere complete! [The crowd cheers and Wernstrom waves to them.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Now look here, Wernstrom. You're making it sound as if the sphere was your idea when we both know... [Shattering glass is heard and a tentacle is through the sphere.] It was! All credit to my colleague, Ogden Wernstrom!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It's horrible!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I can't make it! Go on without me! [Pull back to reveal he's holding onto Leela's boot.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I'm trying! [She struggles to pull him, but slowly does.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Go on without me faster!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Sweet squid of Madrid! The tentacle got Fry!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Quick, hand me my machete! We can still save his legs!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Silence! [The crowd goes quiet.] I have traveled far and seen deep, and I have come to know the purpose of our existence.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Finally.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Character: Fry (who is now shown on the Jumbotron)
Line: Thou shalt love the tentacle!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Well, at least we don't have to love one another.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Character: [Establishing shot of New New York. The city has three large spouts of tentacles coming through the sphere that spread all over the city. Cut back to Fry hovering above the stage.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: A new age has begun. The age of the tentacle! [Tentacles enter into the crowd through the fire hydrants.] Open your necks and receive the love!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Ow, my neck!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Ow, my neck!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: My neck feels perfectly... [A tentacle attaches to his neck.] Ow, my neck!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hooray, Zoidberg escaped! [He is attacked by a tentacle.] Hooray, Zoidberg loves the tentacle! [He is pulled through the doggy door by the tentacle.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It got Zoidberg!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Oh, I never knew how much I'd miss him until he was gone! Not that much, as it turns out.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Thus sayeth the tentacle, "Verily, thou shalt rejoice in the house of the tentacle."

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Fry, listen to yourself. You've been brainwashed.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: No, I'm just trying to fit my diction to the importance of what I'm saying. Please, let me speak. [A laser points at his forehead.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I'm listening.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Don't be afraid of the tentacle, Leela. [He grabs part of the tentacle that is attached to him and pets it.] It's beautiful and it loves me. And I love it. [A second laser appears on his forehead and a cocking gun is heard.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Aw. That's so nice for both of you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I know it may seem strange that I have feelings for an octopus monster from another universe. And yes, perhaps it's not the storybook romance that's been crammed down our throats by (quoting the syllables) "Hollywood." But the Monsterpus has loved us from afar since we were amoebas. [He looks up at the anomaly. Leela slips off her boot and pulls out another gun to aim at Fry's forehead while he turned away. A third laser appears on his forehead.] Only when the space anomaly opened could it finally express a billion years of longing.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [She pulls the guns away from him.] Really? It loves us that much? Fire Diamondium cannon!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hey! [He yelps as he's constantly swung out of harm's way.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: No effect. The crystals are bouncing off the tentacle like meatballs off Mothra.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Oh, what a surprise. I told you Diamondium was worthless!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Wernstrom, quit hyping your cheap Diamondillium and look at this.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Uh-oh.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: What oh?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: According to this blinking light, the tentacle is made of electro-matter, matter's bad-ass grandma! Nothing from our universe can cut through it. Not Diamondium, not Diamondillium, not even your wife's pound cake, Hermes! (To Wernstrom ) She's a terrible cook. (To All ) Anyway, we're all dead.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [He sighs.] So, Bender, is something wrong? Who said that? Oh, it was me! 'Cause my roommate doesn't notice or even care that I'm upset!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: What, Bender? Is something wrong?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Yes! I joined a club I thought was cool, but it turns out all the leaguie-weegies are totally lame. That's what we call ourselves, "leaguie-weegies."

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I'm sorry. I should've asked what was bothering you. [A shot of Fry's back reveals the tentacle reaching from Fry's upper neck to lower spine in a very scar-like manner.] I've been kind of preoccupied.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: With what?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [while putting on his vestment] Well, I went to another universe, and I fell in love with a giant octopus, and now I'm pope of a new religion.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Weren't you already pope of something?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [He puts on his Pope hat.] No.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Oh. Well, I'm just saying I'd like you to show an interest in my life, too.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Okay, let's catch up soon. But right now, I gotta go shove a tentacle into everyone in China. [He squeezes/yanks on the tentacle and is yanked through the window of the apartment and out into space.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: They're coming! Those horrible, horrible things are coming! (Calm) Morbo?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: As the universe falls prey to the revolting alien, only a few isolated pockets of resistance remain.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Those pockets sure are missing out on a great thing.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Amy?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Sorry. I thought I saw a tentacle, but it was just a harmless land squid. [She points to a land squid as it squeals and shuffles back into a hole in the wall. She sighs as she walks over to the cocoffee machine.] I better have some cocoffee.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: When I gave up diapers, my parents promised exactly this would never happen!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Nobody panic! Just get to the panic room! [Amy, Hermes, Farnsworth and Wernstrom go through the door while Leela holds off the pursuing tentacles.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Well done, people! We had a great first week. We got 90% of world leaders, everyone who bought a Hanes undershirt, and this year's most promising new R&B group, give it up for the Grammy-nominated Funkalistics!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [They harmonize.] (singing) Talkin' 'bout the tentacle!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Good news, everyone! I was up all night inventing, and then finally, I invented!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Invented what?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [He holds up half of a toilet paper tube with an elastic attached to each side.] The neck protector, [He holds up a smaller version.] the neck protector junior, and now, for a limited time, [He holds up a version with a flower on it.] the lady neck protector!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I'll take two. My neck is huge.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: We're perfectly safe now. Time to stop living like a bunch of nervous nellies. [A diagrams on the screen shows a dotted line disappearing from around the building. "SECURITY SYSTEM OFFLINE" flashes on the screen.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [She examines the invention.] Professor, these look like you cut them from cardboard toilet paper tubes.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: So? [The hangar doors retract open.] Lots of important inventions are made from toilet paper tubes. [Farnsworth looks back to the keyboard and screen and Leela spots a tentacle in Farnsworth's neck.] Microscopes, the internet, tentacle polish...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It got the professor!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Wait, why am I screaming? It got me, too! [He floats up to Farnsworth.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Stop, in the name of love!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Crud. We may be the last two normal people on Earth. At least I won't have to trim my elbow talons anymore.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I'm scared! And I miss Kif!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: It's okay to cry, Amy. Come here, I'm wearing absorbent shoulder straps. [They hug.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [He pops the top of his head out of a dumpster.] Mmm. What an erotic display of girl-on-girl consolation.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Zapp?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hurry, Leela, we don't have much time to begin repopulating Earth. Go brush your teeth. I'll be waiting for you naked under this keh-suh-dilluh. [He places the Mexican treat on his head and saunters back down into the dumpster. Hermes floats into the alley with a gang of tentacles around him. Amy, Leela and Zapp gasp.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Stop resisting, my brethren! Don't you want to be part of something bigger than yourselves? Like a big crazy monster? [Zapp whimpers.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: So we got her, huh? Bring her in!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Do it already! [He motions at someone.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hello, Colleen.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Fry, please!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: If this is about your futon, I sold it to pay the phone bill that you skipped out on!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Colleen wasn't satisfied with me. Were you, Colleen?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Come on, Fry, this isn't cool!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: She had to have four other boyfriends! I guess she never thought I'd become tentacle pope of the world!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: You know what? It's true! You weren't enough for me! No one man is! You were great, but you weren't Chinese, you weren't Cameroonian, and you certainly were not the "king of karaoke," as you so often claimed. [Fry is aghast.] And if your ego can't take that, then you don't deserve to be tentacle pope of anything!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Character: Fry (Raising into the air with clenched fists.)
Line: Oh, yeah, Colleen? Well, I've got one thing to say to you. [He lowers down to her.] (Calm) I completely agree!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: You, you... What?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Why should you be satisfied with one man when love needs to share itself with the whole universe?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Wow, Fry. You know, that's really... [Fry moves a tentacle in front of her face and she shrieks as it grabs onto her neck.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Love the tentacle, honey.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I do love the tentacle.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Come on out, guys! [Chu, Schlomo, Ndulu and Bolt come out of hiding.] There's enough love for everybody! [They all hug and raise into the air higher.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Aw. [He throws up salt water fish and a duck with water into two buckets. The duck flaps it feathers and quacks.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: We're trapped!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Help, help! Is anyone out there?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Bender to Leela. I read you. [Pull out, Bender is leaning against the wall a couple of feet away from them.] (Direct) 'Sup, bigboots?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Bender, we need a place to hide!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Please!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Pretty please!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: You humans are so cute when you're scared. In here.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: My leg feels funny!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Humans are disgusting! I opened one up once. I almost barfed.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Did you know their hair just keeps growing and growing? My leg feels funny!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Leela, you're crushing me with your rock-hard butt.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Sorry.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: [A close view of his face. It is moving back and forth.] Mmm. I can only imagine what rock-hard part of Leela is crushing me. [Pull back to reveal it is a actuator ramming into the back of his head.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Anyone mind if I turn up the heat a tad?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: I can't take it! I'm being steamed in my own velour!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Death to humans!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: My leg feels better!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hi, Bender.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Bender, you know these humans?

She is too scared to speak.] As my ex-lover, you're naturally shocked and jealous, but you may well get your chance again someday. How about today at 4 00?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Hey, this isn't so bad.

Line: Yivo. Yivo is the lover of all beings, male and female. But Yivo has no gender, thus Yivo has proclaimed that instead of "he" or "she," we are to use the word "shklee." And instead of "him" or "her," we are to use the word "shklim," or "shkler."

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: Phew! I've been sweating the nomenclature all week.

Line: So here shklee is shklerself, Yivo!

Line: Yay, Yivo!

Line: Here.

Line: I am Yivo. In your universe, you are many, but in my universe, I am one. [On the Jumbotron, people are watching him.] For a trillion years I dwelt in solitude, content with my job and my stamp collecting, [On a TV on the Nude Beach Planet Bar.] but then I looked across immensity [On a TV in Lrrr's house.] and saw the big bang, and I was, like, [Back at the church.] "Whoa, who's that?" And I knew then that I was lonely.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3
Line: You poor monster!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 3

Line: Good news, everyone. Tomorrow you'll be making a delivery to Ebola 9, the virus planet.
Why can't they go today?
Because tonight's a special night and I want all of you to be alive. It's the Academy of Inventors' annual symposium.
Wow! I love symposia.
It's the event of the scientific season. Every member presents an invention and the best one wins the Academy prize.
Sounds boring.

Oh, my, yes. But not this year, because my latest invention is unbeatable. Behold! The death clock. [He places a small black box on top on the table.] Simply jam your finger in the hole and this read-out tells you exactly how long you have left to live.
Does it really work?
Well it's occasionally off by a few seconds. What with free will and all.
Sounds like fun. How long do I have left to live?
Ooh! Dibs on his CD player!
Oh, my, yes.
Who's the gross nerd?
That's me at the very first symposium. I'm the Academy's oldest living member, you know. These youngsters all look up to me.
Well, well, well. Look who decided to show his wrinkled face.
Why don't you just leave me alone, Wernstrom?
Face it, Farnsworth, you're over the hill. It's time to leave science to the 120-year-olds.
You young turks think you know everything. I was inventing things when you were barely turning senile.
Go home before you embarrass yourself, old man. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm going to take a nap before the ceremonies.
Who's that jerk?
A hundred years ago he was my most promising student at Mars University. But then, after one fateful pop-quiz...
A-minus? No one gives Ogden Wernstrom an A-minus!
I'm sorry, but penmanship counts.
I swear I'll have my revenge even if it takes me a hundred years.
And here it is  Slightly over 99 years later and still no revenge. I'm essentially in the clear.
I've been perusing your fortified wine list and I've selected the '71 Hobo's Delight, the '57 Chateau Parté and the '66 Thunder Chevitz.
Exquisite choices, sir.
And mix them all together in a big jug.

Welcome to this year's Academy of Inventors Annual Symposium. I'm your host, Ron Popeil, inventor of Mr. Microphone, the spray-on toupee and, of course, the technology to keep human heads alive in jars. [A few people applaud.] But wait, there's more. We've got a whole line-up of inventors tonight, starting with that up and coming young star, Ogden Wernstrom.
[shouting] More wine!

Distinguished members of the Academy, I present to you, the Reverse Scuba Suit. Observe! [He waves a stick in front of a fish in a tank.] Fetch! [He throws the stick across the platform and his fish puts on the suit, which has two little mechanical legs. The fish gets out of the tank, walks across the stage, picks up the stick and hands it to Wernstrom.] Now, sit! [The fish doesn't do anything.] I said sit! [Still nothing.] Bad fish!
Don't worry, Professor, it's no competition for your death clock.
And what will you be presenting this evening, grandpa?
Let's just say it'll put you young whippersnappers in your place!
I just hope it's not as lame as that death clock you presented last year.
Uh, last year, you say?
That's right.
Oh, my! Did it put you young whippersnappers in your place?
Hardly! We laughed until our teeth fell out. Come along, Cinnamon.
Oh, dear. I'll have to invent something new in the next ten minutes. Perhaps some sort of death clock.
Uh, Professor...?
Our last presentation comes from our oldest member, Professor Hubert Farnsworth. Professor?
Just a second, just a second.
Pencils down, prune-face.

Uh, yes, here I am, OK, now, hello there. Now, we all know telescopes allow us to see distant objects. But what if we want to smell distant objects? Well now we can! Thanks to my new invention ... the Smellescope.
Oh, I say!

The odour travels past this coffee stain here, around the olive pit and into this cigar burn. And this appears to be a doodle of myself as a cowboy. [The audience laughs.] But the Smellescope is brilliant, I tell you! Think of the astronomical odours you'll smell thanks to me. [The audience laughs again. Farnsworth wipes his brow with the paper.] Oh, my!
I've waited a hundred years for this, Farnsworth. I give your invention the worst grade imaginable  An A-minus-minus.
And now for the presentation of the award. Listen, folks, I'm practically giving this prize away to Dr. Wernstrom, for his fish thingy.
Perhaps 149 is just too old to be a scientist.
Yep!
No, Professor, don't give up. There were plenty of times in my century when I was gonna give up but I never did. Never! Hey, are you even listening to me? Oh, I give up!
By God, you're right! I'm going to build that Smellescope!
Eureka!
Did you build the Smellescope?
No, I remembered that I'd built one last year. Go ahead, try it. You'll find that every heavenly body has its own particular scent. Here, I'll point it at Jupiter.
Smells like strawberries.
Exactly! And now Saturn.
Pine needles. Oh, man, this is great! Hey, as long as you don't make me smell Uranus.
I don't get it.
I'm sorry, Fry, but astronomers renamed Uranus in 2620 to end that stupid joke once and for all.
Oh. What's it called now?
Urectum. Here, let me locate it for you.
No, no, I think I'll just smell around a bit over here! [He points the Smellescope around the sky and sniffs.] Hmm. [He sniffs again.] Hmm.
What is it? [He sniffs and reacts.] Oh, jeez! Oh, man! Remarkable! A stench so foul it's right off the Funk-o-Meter. I dare say Fry may have discovered the smelliest object in the known universe.
Ooh! Ooh! Name it after me!
I think it's moving.

Hmm. Perhaps the computer can calculate its trajectory. [He clicks a few buttons.] My God! Whatever it is, it's headed straight for us. With enough force to reduce this entire city to a stinky crater. We have less than 72 hours.
Well, let's get looting!
So this thing's gonna destroy the whole city? [A hologram of the object hits the hologram of the Earth with a splat.] What the heck is it?
Ah! Just as I thought. The answer lies in this movie I found on the Internet.

[voice-over; in movie] New York City  The year 2000. The most wasteful society in the history of the galaxy and it was running out of places to empty its never-ending output of garbage. [People throw black bags full of rubbish out of office windows and they are bulldozed away.] The landfills were full. New Jersey was full. And so, under cover of darkness, the city put its garbage out to sea on the world's largest barge. [A man resembling Rudy Giuliani unties a barge filled with garbage and pushes it away from the pier.] The repulsive barge circled the oceans for 50 years but no country would accept it, not even that really filthy one. You know the one I mean. Finally, in 2052, the city used its mob connections to obtain a rocket and launch the garbage into outer space. Some experts claim the ball might return to Earth someday, but their concerns were dismissed as "depressing".
Wow! You got that off the Internet?  In my day the Internet was only used to download pornography.
Actually that's still true.
[in movie] Now that the garbage is in space, doctor, perhaps you can help me with my sexual inhibitions.
[in movie] With gusto!
So that's the situation. Due to the short-sightedness of Old New York, New New York is going to be destroyed by a giant ball of garbage.
Fry, what the hell were you people thinking back then? How could you just throw your garbage away?
Hey, gimmie a break! What do you do with it?
We recycle everything. Robots are made from old beer cans.
Yeah! And this beer can is made outta old robots.
And that sandwich you're eating is made of old discarded sandwiches. [Fry looks inside the sandwich and cringes.] Nothing just gets thrown away.
The future is disgusting.
Typical 20th century attitude.
Hey! You have no right to criticise the 20th century. We gave the world the lightbulb, the steamboat and the cotton gin.
Those things are all from the 19th century.
Yeah, well, they probably just copied us.
Please! There's no time for this now. This is an emergency. We must warn the mayor.
Garbage ball, huh? That sounds serious.
Very serious, Mayor Poopenmeyer.
I gotta be sure this isn't another scientific fraud like global warming or second-hand smoke. [He presses the intercom.] Send in my science advisor.
Wernstrom!
Well, well, well! Come to present your latest napkin, Professor?
No, I'm here because a giant trash ball is heading straight for us. Smell for yourself.
Hey! Holy jeez!
That smell could be anything; a faulty stench coil, some cheese on the lens, who knows?
Mr. Mayor, we just got this transmission from Neptune.
[on tape] Giant ... garbage ball ... [A gasp.] ... passed close by ... horrible stench.
The transmission cuts out there, sir. [The voice chokes again.] No, I, guess it keeps going.
There we go.
My God! The senile old man is right.
Do you mean him or me?
Him!
[on TV] Next, New New York in crisis. Morbo?
[on TV] Thanks, human female. Puny Earthlings were shocked today to learn that a ball of garbage will destroy their pathetic city of New New York.
[on TV] Makes me glad we live here in Los Angeles.
[on TV] Morbo agrees!
Can't we just shoot a missile at it?
We've simulated that on a supercomputer but the ball is just too damn gooey. A missile would go right through it.
But suppose we send a crew to plant an explosive precisely on the fault line between this mass of coffee grounds and this deposit of America Online floppy disks.
In theory, it could work.
Uh, in theory, perhaps. But you'll never find a crew willing to take on a mission so suicidally dangerous.
Oh, crap!
Now, you'll only have one chance to destroy the ball. After that, it will be so close to Earth that blowing it up would cause garbage to rain over the entire planet, killing billions.
[ironic] Oh, boo-hoo!
Now here's the bomb I've prepared. Once you activate it, you'll have 25 minutes to get away.
That's all? But--
Now, now, there'll be plenty of time to discuss your objections when and if you return.
Odour at magnitude 8. [The ship shakes.] Magnitude 12. [The ship shakes.] Magnitude 31. [The ship shakes.] We're breaking up. Turn on the anti-smell device.
Hmm, sporty!
Wow!
Look at all this filth.

It's not filth. It's a glorious monument to the achievements of the 20th century. [He picks up something.] Look! A real Beanie Baby. [He picks up something else.] Oh! A Mr. Spock collector's plate! [He sees something and gasps.] Some Bart Simpson dolls!
Eat my shorts!
OK [He eats the shorts.] [´ la Homer Simpson] Mmm! Shorts!
Fry, this stuff was garbage when it was new. Let's blow it up already!
This junk isn't garbage! I can dig in any random pile and find something great.
[gasping] Alright, let's get to work.

Let's see. If that's Hypodermic Ridge then the bomb must go right here. [She puts the bomb in the ground.] Get ready to run. We've got 25 minutes. [She presses the button and the timer changes to 15 00.] Uh, 15 minutes. [The timer changes again to 05 00.] 5 minutes. [The timer changes again to a very odd number.] "6h" minutes?
There's your problem. The Professor put the counter on upside-down.
That idiot! It wasn't set for 25 minutes, it was set for 52 seconds.
We're gonna die! (calmly) Right?
Right!
It's gonna blow!
Hey, watch it! You'll put somebody's eye out!
OK, OK, keep your space pants on. I'll take care of this.
We're saved!
Yeah, but this garbage ball's unstoppable now. New New York is done for.
[on TV] All in all, this is one day Mittens the kitten won't soon forget!
[on TV] Kittens give Morbo gas. In lighter news, the city of New New York is doomed. Blame rests with known human Professor Hubert Farnsworth and his tiny, inferior brain.

Oh, how could I have put that bomb timer on upside-down? I could swear I followed the manual precisely. [He pulls out the manual from his coat. It is upside-down.] I'm a dried up husk of a scientist. This is all my fault.

No, it's my fault too. I'm sure I threw out more than my share of that trash up there. Also, one month my toilet broke and it just went straight in the garbage can. [Poopenmeyer cringes.] Leela was right. The people of the 20th century were idiotic slobs. Especially me.
Enough! You all failed miserably. It's time to put a real scientist in charge.
Wernstrom!
The very same.
Dr. Wernstrom, can you save my city?
Of course. But it'll cost you. First I'll need tenure.
Done.
And a big research grant.
You got it.
Also, access to a lab and five graduate students, at least three of them Chinese.
Um, alright done. What's your plan?
What plan? I'm set for life! Au revoir, suckers!
That rat! Do something!
I wish I could but he's got tenure!
It's time to take action. [He presses the intercom.] Stephanie, cancel the maid for today. Have her come tomorrow. [He leans back into his chair.] Well, I'm out of ideas. Anyone?
Wait! If we could build an object the exact size, density and consistency of the garbage ball, it might just knock the ball away without smashing it to bits.
But where can we find a substance the exact density and consistency as garbage?
Alas, I don't know.
Uh, what about garbage?
Good Lord! A second ball of garbage! That just might work!
But garbage isn't something you just find lying in the streets of Manhattan. This city's been garbage-free for 500 years!
Then it's time to make some more.
Make garbage? But how?

Stand back and watch the master! This Slurm can. [He knocks it on the floor.] Now it's garbage. These papers. [He sweeps them off the desk with his hands.] Garbage. This picture of your wife. [He drops it on the floor and the frame smashes.] Pure garbage. Now you try it.
By God, I think the boy's got something. Come on, everyone! The fate of the city is at stake!

Good! [He turns to Leela.] Don't finish that cruller, throw it away [Leela throws it on the floor.] Bender. Drink that beer and drop the bottle on the ground. [Bender throws the bottle on the floor.] Very nice.
Get that robot some more beer! [Bender smiles.] We've trashed this room but that's just the start. We've got to get Fry's message to the people.
[on TV] People of New New York, take a lesson from the 20th century. Stop all this pain-in-the-ass recycling and throw your garbage on the floor.
[on TV] Go ahead. Just chuck it any old place like I used to. Your city is counting on you.
If my calculations are correct, this garbage ball will knock the other garbage ball directly into the sun.
And if my calculations are correct, we're all going to die horribly.
Alright, places everyone. Prepare for launch.
Five, four, three, two, three, four, five, six...
[whispering] Just fire the damn thing.
Oops!
Burning garbage!
It worked!

And so, on behalf of the entire city, I thank you, Professor Farnsworth. I now present you with the Academy prize, which we confiscated from Dr. Wernstrom after it became apparent that he was a jackass.
Yes! In your face, Wernstrom!
I'll get you, Farnsworth. Even if it takes me another hundred years.
And, Fry, we owe you a tremendous debt as well. If not for your 20th century garbage-making skills, we'd all be buried under 20th century garbage.
Should we really be celebrating? I mean, what if the second garbage ball returns to Earth like the first one did?
Who cares? That won't be for hundreds of years.
Exactly! It's none of our concern.
That's the 20th century spirit!

Line: [He clears his throat.] This is awkward.

Line: Please, please, give me another chance. We rushed into this relationship, but let's start over as friends and see where things go.

Line: Take me back, Kif?

Line: Planetary annihilators.

Line: Very well, but no sugar on the first date.

Line: All in favour? [Most people raise their hands.] All opposed? [Only one hand is raised.]  Motion is carried.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: This is bogus, man.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: ...six, seven, eight!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Character: [Bender suddenly turns around, closes one eye, takes aim and fires once at Calculon. Calculon groans as his arm disappears. The shot continues on through a tree, then a body of water. It enters the city, traveling through multiple building and is growing in size.  Cut back to a moaning Calculon.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Nine, ten, fire. Yes, I got him! Wohoo!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: My fellow Earthlicans, commence preparations for our date with Yivo.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I had a wonderful time.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Me, too!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Bender, you've cheated, insulted and maimed me.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Uh-huh.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: And thoroughly destroyed our own secret headquarters in the process. [Pull back to show a large hole in the side of their building.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Hey, it's easy to criticize.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I'm so disgusted by your loathsome behaviour that I hereby resign from this imbecilic club and relinquish the presidency to you. [He removes a magnetic patch from his chest and sticks it on Bender's.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Thanks, Calculon. Can I have your autograph? [He holds up a book.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: You certainly can. [He signs the book.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Reports, people, reports! How did our universe's date go?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He pulls out a file folder. "TOP SECRET" is stamped on the outside.] Oh, it was really fun. We went to a cute French place in the village. My lamb chop fell on the floor, but they brought me another one.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Okay, Yivo showed us a good time. No one's denying that, but shklee hasn't offered our universe any kind of commitment, and we're 14 billion years old. That is too old to play the field.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I can't stand this!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Shut up! Shut up, you creepwads! Fry, you're closer to Yivo than anyone. What's the skinny?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I love Yivo, but it's true, there's been no hint of a commitment. I don't know if can put my heart on the line again only to have it broken and stomped on like a nerd's face.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: All in favour of dumping Yivo?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Aye.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He sniffles.] Aye. [He hits Delete and Yivo's name fades from the display.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Resolved. Our universe will dump Yivo. How shall we break the news?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Let's just send a text message. Say we're going through some weird stuff right now.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: No, we should at least deliver the news in person. Our universe has always tried to be classy.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: If there's one thing Nixon is known for, it's class. Let's cut this turd loose.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Yeah!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Hey, Bender, you seem perky today.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Yep, you wanna go grab a booze?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I can't right now. We're going to the other universe.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Great, I'll make Hot Pockets. [He turns a dial on his chest to 350F.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Bender, you know robots can't go through the anomaly. Living beings only.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Ow! Ow! Mmm. [He is heard eating the treats.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Too long have we been slaves to the meatbags. They pretend to be our friends, but they're not 'cause they're too busy!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: So, what of it?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: My fellow leaguie-weegies, the time has come to overthrow humanity!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Oh, now, Bender, I hate to defecate on your parade, but we have only six dues-paying members and we're a rather fey and doughy lot. To overthrow humanity, we'd need a damned army.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Then a damned army we shall have!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He giggles.] I rather think we could strike a deal, Bender. I shall give you your army of the damned, and in return I ask just one thing, just one itty-bitty thing. Your firstborn son. [He laughs evilly.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He stands up.] Just a sec.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Daddy, I knew you'd come back! [He runs across the street and jumps into Bender's arms. They hug. Cut back to the Robot Devil still laughing. Bender walks in with his son sitting on his shoulder.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Here you go.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Wow! That was pretty brutal even by my standards.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: No backsies.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Who is it? [They all exclaim in disgust.] Oh, hi, honey-poo. What's up? The movie's not for another hour.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Um... So... So, yeah, the thing is...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Look, I made homemade Twizzlers!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: This is hard. Yivo, you know how sometimes things break up? Well...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Wait, hang on. I was looking for the perfect moment, but what the heck, I'll burst if I wait another second.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Sweet Sally in the alley!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Break-up delegation, before we hear your report, our grateful universe is proud to honour you with the great taste of Charleston Chew! [Charleston Chew fireworks explode in the background and the crowd cheers.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Thank you, Nixon. [He clears his throat.] Everyone everywhere, brace yourselves for the most shocking development in the history of the human race.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: The human race can bite my shiny metal ass! [He runs over a barricade and the crowd gasps and moves out of his way. Behind Bender are thousands upon thousands of robots exiting from the top of Mt. Saint Hell.] For thousands of years, robots have slaved for humanity, yet when the time came to hang out with them, they were all, like, "Maybe later, Bender." Well, it's later now, meatbags! So late, that we're taking over Earth! [He laughs evilly.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Okay.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: What?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: We don't need it anymore. Yivo proposed. [A large hand shows off the ring.] We're moving in with shkler. [The crowd cheers.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: You... You're leaving? But why can't Yivo just move in with us? We'll put a cot in Europe.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Don't be daft, Bender. Yivo can't breathe outside the electric ether of shkler own universe. If shklee came here, shklee would shkluffocate.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: No shklit?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Look, fantastical golden escalators.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I love this part.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Wait. I didn't agree to...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: This place makes Nutley look like crap.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I'll miss you, Bender, but I have to follow my heart. You and your robots take good care of Earth. Here, these are the keys to the Bermuda Triangle. Lock up when the world ends. Goodbye, my friend.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Wait. [Whispering ] Let me come with you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I'm sorry, Bender. Robots don't go to heaven. [The escalators retract up with Fry's departure.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Death to humans.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Welcome, welcome, everyone. Oh, you look so beautiful. I wish I'd had more time to straighten up. My harps are just lying everywhere.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Oh, relax, it's fine. It looks lived in.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Let's heat up some leftovers and then spend eternity together. I have only one request. Now that you're here, promise me you'll never, ever communicate with any other universe.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: We promise, Yivo. As far as we're concerned, you're the only universe in the world. [He kisses a tentacle and Leela exclaims in disgust.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Has humanity called?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: No, sir.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Check my messages. A flashing light means somebody called.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I know what it means.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Am I the only one who thinks this is all a sham?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Yes.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: This isn't heaven. It just looks exactly like it, and makes us immortal, which I find suspicious.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Allow me to explain. Centuries ago, I sent an image of myself into the minds of your artists. The heavenly clouds they painted depict a vapour I exude.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I wish I exuded anything that smelled half that good.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Then what about these angels? Some kind of Scooby Doo-esque flashlight projection?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Actually, those are mindless jakabirds. [A shot of two jakabirds eating green larvae is shown.] They keep my surface free of parasitic larvae. [The jakabirds cluck like chickens.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: You didn't like Country Bear Jamboree either, Leela. There's no pleasing you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Dearest Bender. How are you? I am fine. Everyone is happy here except Leela, but you know her. She didn't like Country Bear Jamboree, either. I'm so madly in love with Yivo, I feel like a schoolgirl with a crush on Justin Timberlake, and then she moves into a tiny house on his head. We have giant rubies that taste like root beer. Sincerely, Fry.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Letter for you, hyperlord Bender.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Give me that! [He grabs it from Robot 1-X and reads the text on the wings of the plane. "from  Philip J. Fry/Heaven To  Bender"]Honeymoon's over, eh? Turns out your octopus girlfriend is a big nag with curlers in her tentacles, huh? Well, let's just see if Bender will take you back. [He opens the letter and reads it.] Oh. [He drops his head down and throws the paper away from him. The electro-matter makes it act like a razor sharp boomerang and it slices through a trashcan, Robot 1-X and then gets stuck in the fireplace mantel.] Stupid electro-matter. That was my best trash can.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Misfile me under "U" For "euphoric."

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: You get an infinite number of meat dishes, and a free refill on the soda. [He eats a taco.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Eureka. Another elementary proof of the Goldbach conjecture. [They both jump into each other and slam chests. Pan over to Leela who is watching them.]]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Okay, I admit people seem happy. But it's all so wholesome. And that's what's wrong with heaven. It's boring. There's no sleaze.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: It time snu-snu.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Me like snu-snu.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Last one to Mattress Island is a rotten egg.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Why were we so angry and jealous back in our universe?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I don't know. It was all so childish.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Look, it's Leela.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Hi, Leela.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I'm sorry you're not happy here, Leela. I'll call you an escalator. You'll always be my little purple pumpkin. [He holds himself from crying.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [She sighs.] You know, Yivo, I've loved and lost so many times that I was afraid. But I'm not anymore. I want to stay here, with you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Ow! Ow!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: What's happening?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Hey!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: If robots can't go to heaven, heaven can come to us! [Robots are turning a wheel on the ship, dragging Yivo closer and closer to their universe. A view of the anomaly shows Yivo as shklee is painfully pulled through the anomaly.] All hands abaft! Army of the damned, prepare to board heaven!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Take that, you scurvy Kraken! That'll teach you to despoil our human booty!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: 'Allo, big beak! [He pulls a sword out of his mouth and leaps from his ship to one of Yivo's horns. Yivo bites at him, but misses.] Too slow! [Yivo bites again, but Bender leaps to another horn.]  Missed me again! [Another bite, but Bender leaps away again. However, it is revealed Yivo bit off one of his footcups. Bender groans in pain.] Me footcup! I'll stab you! [Wild noises come out of Bender as he defends himself.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Bender, stop destroying heaven.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Shut up, doofy. I'm rescuing you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Character: Yivo (As shklee bashes Bender into shklerself)
Line: Leave my living beings alone! I love them. Something you, a lifeless mechanism, will never understand.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: He's right, Bender. Please, take your little pink sword and go home. {Fry did not say shklee here.}

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Seriously? But, I did this whole pirate-themed attack for you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Wait a second. Let me see that sword. [Yivo grabs the sword from Bender with a tentacle.] Fry, where did he get this electro-matter? [Text on the pink portion of the sword says "How are," "Dearest Bender," "girl," "with Yivo," and "Sincerely Fry."]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Um... [He coughs.] Is it dry up here?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: How could you, Fry? Why do you think I asked you not to contact other universes?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I didn't think...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: No, you didn't. You broke your promise and you broke my heart. Just go. All of you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Ow!

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: I must leave now. The nature of your universe is burning me, even worse than my gonorrhea. You should get checked, by the way. If I don't go home now, I'll shkluffocate.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Let me go with you. It'll be just the two of us. We'll make a fire and play Uno.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Fry, stop. That's who we were, not who we are.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: But...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: My only consolation is that I did find one among the quadrillions who truly understands me.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Colleen? Wait a second, are you and Yivo...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: That's right, Fry. Thank you for introducing us. Yivo has taught me what a narrow-minded prude I was before.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Oh, great. So what am I supposed to do now?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Go home. Find a girl from your own universe and live on top of her.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Saved you.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Character: [Bender laughs and the ship leaves Yivo again. Fry cries as he looks back at Yivo and Yivo looks at Fry sadly. Yivo groans as shklee works shklis way back through the anomaly to shklis universe. When shklee is completely through, the anomaly closes itself up and the night sky is normal again. Pull back to reveal Fry watching it through a porthole on the ship.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He sighs.] Maybe Yivo was right. Maybe I should look for love closer to home. [He turns around and looks at Leela.] I don't know, Leela, you think maybe...

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Oh, please. You forgot me quick enough when you met Colleen.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: That's true. [He walks over to Amy.] How about you, Amy?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [She scoffs.] Fry... I'm Kif's Fonfon Ru.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Are you? Well, then perhaps you misunderstood the meaning of the term. It means, "One who doesn't sleep with my superior officer." That's the literal translation.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Give the poor girl a break, Kif. It's not like she had a dictionary. She was butt naked, for God's sakes. [Kif sighs, punches Zapp in the stomach and walks away.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Captain on deck. [He is saluting Bender.]

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: At ease, buckos.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Bender, why did you do it? We were all so happy.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: And we were in love.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: [He scoffs.] That wasn't love.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: What? How can you say that?

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4
Line: Because Bender knows love. And love doesn't share itself with the world. Love is suspicious, love is needy, love is fearful, love is greedy. My friends, there is no great love without great jealousy. [He hugs Fry and Leela, temporarily choking them both.] I love you, meatbags.

Episode: The Beast with a Billion Backs Part 4

Line: Yes, 10!
Well done, Cubonius. You decapitated the unicorn.
All right.
Oh, oh! We search his tail pouch for treasure.
Deep in the unicorn's rump sack, you find... [The boys gasp as he rolls the dice.] 60 gold pieces.
Oh, my God! Oh, my God! Oh, my God!
I cast a spell of detect magic.
[Walking over to the table.] What you doing, mini-meatbags? Underage gambling? Shame on you. Count me in. [He places a wad of cash on the table.]
We're not gambling. We're playing Dungeons & Dragons.
Right now, we're fighting for our lives in the lair of the Dragon Queen.
Ah, wrong. Right now you're ass-deep in a folding chair.
Yes, but in my imagination I'm riding a golden Pegasus. Giddy up, Sparky! [He rides the chair like a horse.]
[Sitting down.] Am I the only one seeing him sitting here with peanut butter on his face?
Bender, were you built without an imagination?
What? Don't be stupid, of course not. It just hasn't descended yet.
Fry, do I have an imagination?
I don't know, Bender. Why do you ask? Were the other boys making fun of you?
Mhmm. They said I couldn't imagine things.

Well, you never know unless you try. Like, I didn't know if I could swallow a softball, so I gave it my best shot and voilà! [He lifts his shirt to reveal a large lump in the middle of his abdomen.] Wait, that's not it. [He twists to the left a bit to reveal a second hump.] Ah, thar she blows!
Warning, out of dark matter fuel.
That's not a warning. A warning is supposed to come before something bad happens.

Character: Ship's Computer (with a more stern alarm)
Line: Warning, engines will shut down in one second.
That's more like it.
Uh-oh. This space neighborhood looks kind of sketchy.
[He flies onto the front of the ship and yanks off the hood ornament.] Rock 'n' roll.
Hey, that punk stole our hood ornament. Now no one will know we have the LX package.
We need dark matter and we need it fast. Fry, check Nibbler's litter box. Maybe he dropped a steamer.
Aye, aye, Captain. Yes! I've never been so excited to see poop. Well, maybe once.
[Cheering]
There's gas in our ass.
Can you believe the price of dark matter? It'd be cheaper to fill the tank with Nobel Prize winners' sperm.
$632.14. Your Speedpass will now be charged.
You lousy...
Hey, gets a loads of that ugly ship. What shades of green is that? Puke?
For your information it's called Electric Mucus.
More like puke.
Whoa!
Why don't you come a little closer so my boot can hear you?
[Restraining her.] Calm down, Leela. You can vent tonight on your blog.
What's the matters, you couldn't affords the LX package?
Puke-a-doodle-do.
You're making fun of our ship? Your ship is the most beat-up thing I've ever seen, and I've seen Mickey Rourke's head.
